programme.desc: Treasure hunter Marty Lagina and Ancient Astronaut theorist Giorgio A. Tsoukalos explore the bizarre statues, mysterious pyramids and gigantic structures left behind by one of the most mysterious cultures in the ancient world in Sardinia, Italy.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio A. Tsoukalos studies India's Sanskrit texts, which are filled with descriptions of brain surgery, flying crafts, nuclear physics, and other advanced sciences; Hindu scholars attribute this knowledge to a time when gods walked among humans.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Robots are being programmed to do everything from performing surgery on humans, to investigating other planets; humanoid robots are quickly reaching a level of sophistication that was thought to exist only in science fiction.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Could gold be the ultimate link between humans and aliens? A church in southern France is said to hold the key to alchemy.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Researchers explore the strange similarities among pyramids in Egypt, Central and South America, China, Africa, and Indonesia, including a possible extraterrestrial link connecting these structures.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens

programme.title: Killer Cases
programme.desc: On a summer night, Amanda Colley returns to a ransacked house; her love interest Lamar and two girlfriends arrive to join her, and gunshots ring out; Amanda and her friend Lindy are found dead.

programme.title: Killer Cases
programme.desc: In 1993, a newborn baby's body is discovered; the coroner determines the baby had been born alive; after 25 years, and with the assistance of modern DNA techniques, Gail Eastwood-Ritchey is found guilty of murder and sentenced to life in prison.

programme.title: Killer Cases
programme.desc: Ten days after NBA player Lorenzen Wright goes missing, the player's body is found in a swamp, shot 11 times; police search for clues to identify who killed the basketball star.

programme.title: Killer Cases
programme.desc: When Ohio State senior Reagan Tokes fails to respond to messages from her parents, they fear the worst; their nightmare becomes a reality when a caller reports the discovery of a female body in the local park; detectives race to solve the crime.

programme.title: Monster in My Family
programme.desc: Randy Hausner--brother of serial shooter Dale Hausner--shares the inside story of a man who terrorized the city of Phoenix in a year and a half-long killing spree.

programme.title: Monster in My Family
programme.desc: In the course of one year, 1984--1985, Richard Ramirez conducted a reign of terror over Los Angeles.

programme.title: My Uncle Is the Green River Killer
programme.desc: After living with the stigma of being related to a serial killer, family members confront Gary Ridgeway in an effort to heal their emotional wounds and bring closure to the families of his victims.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: 10/15/86: The Astros scored three runs in the 1st inning and took the lead deep into the 9th, until the Mets retaliated with three runs to send the game into extras. Fast forward to the top of the 16th when Ray Knights hit a go-ahead knock and the rest is history!

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Ed Kranepool hits a home run as the Mets shut out the Orioles 5-0 to win Game 3.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: World Series Film from 1980 highlights the Phillies capturing their first win in their 98-year span.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1981 matchup between the Dodgers and the Yankees. New York took a 2-0 series lead, but Los Angeles battled back behind strong pitching and a deep lineup to secure the World Series championship.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1986 matchup between the Mets and the Red Sox. A famous error in the 10th inning of Game 6 from Boston's Bill Buckner helped New York rally from a 3-2 series deficit and take home the World Series championship.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: The first World Series to be played in an indoor ballpark, the Twins used their familiarity with the Metrodome to their advantage to capture their first World Series Championship since moving to Minnesota.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: Energized by an unthinkable pinch-hit walk-off homer from Kirk Gibson, the Los Angeles Dodgers rally to upset the Oakland Athletics in five games to win the 1988 World Series.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1991 matchup between the Twins and the Braves. Both teams went from worst to first before battling it out in a close series that showcased five games decided by one run and the Twins securing the World Series title.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: On April 3, 2018 in his first-ever at-bat at Angel Stadium, Japanese phenom Shohei Ohtani crushes a three-run home run, earning himself a curtain call from the Los Angeles crowd.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: On the day of Thurman Munson's funeral, eulogist Bobby Murcer leads the Yankees to a walk-off win.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Just 10 days after the tragic September 11 attacks, Mike Piazza lifts a dramatic go-ahead home run in the 8th inning to lift the Mets and the city of New York in the first baseball game played in the city after the tragedy.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: On September 26, 2016, the Marlins overcame the tragic loss of pitcher Jos Fernndez to secure an emotional victory, rallying together to honor his memory and celebrate his life amidst profound grief and sorrow.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Roy Halladay outpitches Mark Buehrle in a duel on the mound in the Blue Jays' 2-0 win.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Tony Prez leads the Reds to clinch World Series over Boston

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Ichiro Suzuki plays in his final Major League game, announcing his retirement after the Mariners conclude a two-game series with the Athletics at the Tokyo Dome in Japan.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: One crushed project means new parts for another; the guys take on a NASCAR stock car piloted by Corey LaJoie around Atlanta Motor Speedway by recycling the supercharger from their wrecked T-Bird and slapping it on a 1978 Ford Fairmont.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: The guys transform a Miata into the ultimate nitrous toy, the Man-iata; Newbern challenges Finnegan and Cotten to see if they can keep up with his Honda Talon UTV.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: Newbern surprises Cotten and Finnegan with a visit to the sacred grounds of Dennis Anderson's Digger's Dungeon; the guys rebuild a busted-up mega truck and take on Finnegan's childhood idol in a race against the creator of Grave Digger himself.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: The guys put John Andrade Jr. in a tiny truck and beat him in a mud drag race with the Dirt Track Camaro; Andrade challenges them to see what they can do with a derelict and parted-out Mustang against his 79 Chevy Malibu.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: Cotten challenges Finnegan and Newbern to some front-wheel-drive, high-school-antics-style racing; the guys hop up three cheap import beaters, build metal skids to replace the rear wheels, and have the wildest race to date.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: The LS-powered S-15 mini truck gets a revamp when the guys fix what didn't work from the last time they raced Randy Pobst around a road course in a Shelby GT350.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: The guys transform a '73 Opel funny car into a dirt-roosting machine.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: The dream of long travel suspension on Roadkill's slightly modified Vette Kart finally comes true for the guys; Brad DeBerti helps them figure out how to not taco the front end as they take on a Pro2 truck on an off-road short course.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: Newbern, Cotten, and Finnegan participate in an unusual race that requires their boat to survive the competitors' attacks on a dirt track.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: Newbern and Cotten surprise Finnegan with a 2.3L 1980 Pinto wagon and drift lessons from pro Formula Drift driver Federico Sceriffo; they add a 396ci stroker engine and suspension mods before taking on a 1,000-plus-hp Ferrari 599 GTB.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: Finnegan, Newbern and Cotten do some wheelie R&D to find out what it takes to put a 1978 GMC Class C motorhome's tires in the air; with the help of pro wheelstander Mike Mantel, the guys take on the challenge of making dreams become reality.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: The 1978 GMC motorhome takes on Mike Mantel's Little Red Firetruck.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: Cotten, Newbern and Finnegan make a low-buck version of an OBS Yukon by lowering it, upgrading the suspension and fixing some performance issues.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: Cotton, Newbern, and Finnegan learn how a simple suspension upgrade can become a house of cards; major snags are hit and overcome as they attempt to run an 8-second pass with their supercharged barn-find '67 Firebird known as the Rubber Duck.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: The hill-climbing, ice-racing, nitrous-infused Man-iata is back! Cotten and Newbern take on Finnegan himself to see if they can beat him up the infamous Third Hill at Indian Mountain in the awesome sand drag truck known as the Drag-Kota.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: It's not the size of the car that matters, it's how it's driven; Cotten and Newbern drastically improve the power-to-weight ratio of a teeny '72 Honda Z600 coupe in an attempt to set a record at MidPond Raceway.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: David and Mike cut some serious lap time off a '68 Ford Torino GT as they take on a high-dollar Pro-Touring beast of a Chevy C10; in just two days the guys totally transform their poor-touring Torino.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: Mike and David revitalize their '78 Ford Flairmont; they're stepping into the ring and adding blown LS power to shred even more tires with Bill Goldberg and a Hellcat Redeye at Talladega.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The crew tests the effects of running long vs. short rods on otherwise identical engines; they'll find out if long rods make more torque, if shorter rods' faster swipe makes a difference, or if rod length doesn't actually matter.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys find out which cheap carburetors produce the most expensive results; they pick a fight among remanufactured offerings from Edelbrock, Summit and Demon to see which will pump the most power into their 383 Chevrolet.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys flip things upside down to find out how much power might be left in the oil pan; a number of factors play a part in minimizing turbulence around the crank, but an $1,100 solution may not be worth the cost.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys try to shed light on whether iron or aluminum heads will deliver more power; they'll look at weight savings and heat retention's effect on cylinder pressure.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: A camshaft is causing issues, so the crew explores how changes to cam timing can help tune a power curve for high-end performance or low-end power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys experiment with lash adjustments in an effort unleash more power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys test whether a dual or a single exhaust system has more power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys answer the question of whether a carb spacer produces more power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys do a 4/7 swap on a big 572 to see if there's more power to be had.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys compare four of the most popular intake manifolds on the market.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys take 555 BBC and the Blower Shop then test the difference in power between gas and e85.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys dive into the lobe separation angle of the camshaft.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys explore the gains to be found for a sickly, low-compression 440.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys go through the basics of bringing a motor to the dyno cell.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The crew asks whether it's worth it to upgrade an ignition system.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys explore how header collector length affects power output.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys follow Freiburger's personal quest for 1,000 NA horsepower.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The crew investigates just how much power gets sacrificed to look cool.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys see if lightweight rotating assembly parts help make more power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys test three sets of headers on a power-boosted motor.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys test whether tunnel-ram or cross-ram setups make more power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys see which muffler works best for street-driving 1,000 HP monsters.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys break down two very different engines that make similar numbers.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: Steve Dulcich puts his Leaning Tower of Power to the test.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys test blower cams with their new 363ci small-block Ford.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: After years of dismissal, the guys give the Gen III Hemi a fair shake.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: Carb whisperer Steve Brule has tips to get a Holley 4150 running its best.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: Dulcich tests four aftermarket intake manifolds on his 225ci slant six.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys test which type of cylinder head delivers more power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: We're battling the two most recent iterations of the 5.7 III Hemi.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The Windsor family finally gets its turn at an intake shootout!

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys debate if a solid roller camshaft is worth the extra money.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: We run our LS with factory exhaust manifolds and again with turbo headers.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys deliberately heat and cool fuel to see the difference it makes.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys find out if Max Wedge heads are really a worthwhile upgrade.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: We find out whether header wraps really do create more power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys test out a bunch of Holley's "Ram" intakes on their 6.2-liter LS.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: We test six manifolds with our old-school carb and our new-school 6.0 LS.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys see if exhaust cutouts do more than rattle passersby's eardrums.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The crew super-tunes every HP out of the 410 Windsor from the Disgustang.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys test out three low-buck cylinder heads on a 383 small-block Chevy.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys test how different carb features affect horsepower and tunability.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys challenge their previous findings testing single-pattern cams.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys see if too much oil pressure robs precious horsepower.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys try to boost an 800-horspower 572 up to a comfortable 950+.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys shoot out six packs on a 440 to see which makes the most power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys figure out how to make more power with a flex fuel engine.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys see whether boost and vacuum leaks actually affect power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys see how wet and dry nitrous systems stack up on an EFI manifold.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: Multipoint EFI gets its turn against the venerable Dominator.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: A supercharged medium-sized mill takes on a naturally aspirated big block.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The crew pits a four-barrel carb against dual quads on the tunnel ram.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: The guys test cars that are worlds apart in every way except horsepower.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: The 2019 McLaren 600LT faces off against the 2019 Porsche GT3 RS.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: Jethro and Jonny pit BMW's mighty M2 against the ultralight Alpine A110.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: Jonny and Jethro look at two of the last true hardcore production SUVs.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: The Alfa Romeo Giulia Quadrifoglio is up against the Jaguar Project 8.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: The MAT New Stratos and Superformance GT40 have one foot in the past.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: Jonny and Jethro live out their touring fantasies in two British beasts.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: The guys pit the legendary Shelby GT350 against the new Toyota Supra.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: The 2019 Honda Civic Type R does battle with the 2020 Hyundai Veloster N.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: The '19 Camaro ZL1 1LE goes up against the 2020 Lotus Evora.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: Jonny and Jethro drive the BMW M5 Competition and the Mercedes-AMG GT 63 S.

programme.title: Head 2 Head Drag Race
programme.desc: Hypercars are still insane, but the idea of a supercar doesn't mean what it used to; a supercar is quiet, has room for family and friends, and delivers spine-crunching acceleration, plus exceptional range and even a luxurious driving experience.

programme.title: Head 2 Head Drag Race
programme.desc: Jeff and Jonny can't decide which supertruck is best, or even what the definition of supertruck is; they debate whether it's about how it looks, sounds or drives, horsepower/torque, whether it can be electric, and whether it can even do truck things.

programme.title: Head 2 Head Drag Race
programme.desc: No EV maker has yet cracked the market for hot hatches; they're small, nimble, fun - all things EVs aren't; the guys turn to gasoline to figure out the best hot hatch on the market today: the Toyota GR Corolla or the Honda Civic Type R.

programme.title: Head 2 Head Drag Race
programme.desc: Exploring whether BMW maintains the title of undisputed fast sedan king.

programme.title: Head 2 Head Drag Race
programme.desc: Pitting the Rivian R1S against the Lamborghini Urus to find out which is best.

programme.title: Head 2 Head Drag Race
programme.desc: MotorTrend's favorite talent competes in some fun holiday-spirit racing.

programme.desc: The guys drive Audi's S1 Hoonitron, a car that's next level in all aspects.

programme.title: Mixed Christmas
programme.desc: Aurora wants to enjoy the holidays this year in some warmth and sunshine, and invites her three best friends to Miami for a Christmas trip to remember. When they arrive at their AirBnb, they discover it's been double booked by Aurora's ex-girlfriend and her new partner Axel. They have no choice but to combine their plans, and celebrate the holiday together.

programme.title: What a Day Before Christmas
programme.desc: Nathan and Naomi are at odds about the direction of their marriage, and reluctance to get in the Christmas Spirit is shown by Nathan. As an ultimatum, it is insisted by Naomi that the holidays are spent by Nathan with her and her family, but it is Christmas Eve. The help of Nathan's cousin Keith is enlisted, and a road trip is embarked upon by the two as they race against time. An attempt is made to get home for the holidays and save the marriage.

programme.title: Glistening in the Snow
programme.desc: When struggling club owner Anaja finds out that her co-owner, Donovan, is coming to town for the holiday, she expects him to help keep the doors open. However, his fianc Addie wants him to sell the club. When the owners and staff are trapped in the club during a snow storm, they will have to work together to resolve their issues with each other.

programme.title: CLUTCH
programme.desc: Detectives Clutch and Angel navigate a criminal underworld with the help of three women, whom Clutch is familiar with, to solve the disappearance of a group of women.

programme.title: Conflict of Interest
programme.desc: When Mickey (Christopher McDonald) returns to the police force after a long hiatus, he has his sights set on shady businessman Gideon (Judd Nelson). Everyone knows that Gideon peddles drugs and sex and sells stolen cars. When Mickey's son, Jason (Gregory Alan Harris), is framed for murder, Mickey is set to prove that Gideon is behind it all. In his search for justice and revenge, Mickey is willing to do anything, and he's determined to shut Gideon down forever.

programme.title: Caught in a Trapp
programme.desc: Drama following the journey of a teen boy who is forced into a dangerous life on the streets after the death of his parents.

programme.title: Curves Under the Mistletoe
programme.desc: After losing her mother on Christmas Day and suffering through a difficult childhood, Delight perseveres to find love and her place in the world.

programme.title: Everybody Hates Christmas
programme.desc: When a family loses faith in Christmas, an angel reminds them that the spirit of the holiday is about more than just giving and receiving gifts.

programme.title: Black Santa
programme.desc: A Christmastime tragedy turns the lives of two boys from a loving family in the Houston suburbs upside down and sends them into a foster home.

programme.title: Mother of a Christmas
programme.desc: Ben and his family plan a family vacation to the beach, including his mother-in-law. When his wife and children experience delays at the airport, he has an unforgettable experience being trapped in a house wit his mother-in-law.

programme.title: Missing you this Christmas
programme.desc: Carmen's family has an annual Christmas tradition that supports her neighborhood. When her mother dies suddenly, she looses the holiday spirit, and no longer wants to continue, until she's visited by her late father's spirit who encourages her to keep hope alive.

programme.title: A Holiday for Harmony
programme.desc: Jaxon Moore is a struggling arcade bar owner with debt and facing a possible shutdown before the holiday season. When his sister dies in a car crash, he becomes the guardian of his young niece Harmony, who inherited a trust fund from her late mother.

programme.title: Rain for Christmas
programme.desc: A decision is made by Malik to bring his girlfriend home to Houston for Christmas. When she is met by his family, it is thought by them that he is all wrong for her. The grandpa's nurse, Rain, is met by Malik, and the true meaning of love and what is really wanted for Christmas are soon realized by him.

programme.title: Naughty or Nice
programme.desc: Melody, an exotic dancer, and her doctor boyfriend, Patrick, prepare to spend the holidays with Patrick's family. When they arrive, they are met by Patrick's overprotective judgmental mother, and she unleashes her wrath on Melody, as she's not good enough for her son.

programme.title: Christmas With da Fam
programme.desc: After Malcom proposes to Serenity, she takes him home to meet her family for the holidays. The spirit is alive, until they discover that Serenity's ex Denzel is living with her family after a house fire. A rivalry develops between Malcolm and Denzel that ends up in a hilarious battle of wits over the holiday weekend.

programme.title: Mixed Christmas
programme.desc: Aurora wants to enjoy the holidays this year in some warmth and sunshine, and invites her three best friends to Miami for a Christmas trip to remember. When they arrive at their AirBnb, they discover it's been double booked by Aurora's ex-girlfriend and her new partner Axel. They have no choice but to combine their plans, and celebrate the holiday together.

Meanwhile, Jessica, TJ's ex-wife, faces scrutiny for her past actions and the future of their children. With the threat of child protective services looming, the clock is ticking to find answers and rebuild shattered lives.

Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. On arrival, Rob and Michelle Earp from Seashells B&B in Sutton-on-Sea find a condom by the entrance, and Clare Davies and Fran Hancock from The New Court Hotel in Usk have concerns over interior cleanliness. Tom Jones and Samara Cohen from The Crown at Whitchurch judge the rooms to be little more than functional.

On arrival, Tom and Samara are impressed, but Martin and Hannah find lots of cleanliness issues. At dinner, there are tensions as the group discuss who would take which role if they were to run a B&B together. Breakfast is cooked by Clare, but peppery eggs and missing mushrooms cause concern.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Mesmerized by Bon Bons Belly Dancing, we catch up with our favourite Big Balls in the Qualifier. They dish out punishment to Australias very own female Jim Carrey and send Big Cat tamer Robbie into the pond. Goofy Goggles up the ante on the Dreadmill causing the Breakdancing Dad to create hilarious new moves. Golden Guns, Marisa battles it out for the ladies against Perfect Specimen, Seamus in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: 101 Ways to Leave a Gameshow
programme.desc: More unsuspecting contestants, all competing for a 10k pound prize, are dropped, fired and dragged screaming.

programme.title: 101 Ways to Leave a Gameshow
programme.desc: Steve Jones hosts the series where contestants are ejected in the craziest ways possible.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Its Sitcom Central on Wipeout Australia with the Odd Couple, starring Worlds Strongest Dwarf, David Clarke and Gentle Giant, Tim Watts. Once again the Big Balls deliver some spectacular moments with an Italian Chef being sliced and diced. Sacks are introduced at the Sweeper proving too much for some, but surprisingly helping the ladies to even things out as we go into a 50/50 male, female split in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: During this episode contestants face new challenges on 'The Qualifier'.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: In this episode, contestants face different games like The Qualifier, The Crash Mountain and Dizzy Dummies.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Tonight, twenty brave battlers will take on the wintry weirdness.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: From singing Pastors to Wookies, this week is jammed pack with Characters, who battle it out on the Qualifier with amusing attempts at the inconceivable Field Goal Swing. Its no easy task to earn a spot in the Wipeout Zone this week with the Dreadmill, sorting the men from the boys. Contestants must dodge the wrecking ball while shooting basketballs. Although there is one man who came prepared, Dodgeball Champion Dan Bennett, whose Duck, Dive, Dip, Dodge and Dunk training comes into play.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the second 'Celebrity Special' of the season. This time, all of them face 'The Qualifier'.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: The Qualifier sees the return of an old favourite, the Big Red Balls.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Wipeout Australia debunks the myth that only young, fit and funky people should go on game shows. This week we are forced to take notice of Demolition Dave, a 49 yr old South Australia man who thanks to some home training smashes the qualifier. For those lucky enough to survive the Fly Screen Sweeper it was Dizzy Dummy time. Emerging as the Dark Horse, Kobie Mulligan earned herself a shot in the Wipeout Zone, joined by a Strategist and Rubber Woman resulting in a bitter showdown.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: For the fish course, which dish is going to be king: turbot with brown shrimps and spring vegetables, wild sea bass with shrimp toastie, or bream with hazelnuts and salted caramel?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course. Will the winning dish be Gloucester Old Spot pork with smoked venison, salt marsh lamb with sweetbreads, or oak roast middle white pork with broad beans?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Marcus Wareing chooses his favourite from the three dishes: caramel parfait with honey ice-cream, rhubarb and custard tart with beetroot ice-cream, and strawberries with meringue and mint water ice. For one of the chefs, this is the end of the road.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The heat is on, as only one chef can make it through to the finals and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is it going to be?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All the chefs want the honour of cooking for the Prince and today they begin their menus with the starters: a summer salad of pea mousse with pickled beetroot, ham hock with smoked cheddar mousse and chicken terrine with asparagus, onion and jasmine.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from Wales - Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Aled Williams - pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: poached lobster with confit potatoes, sea bass with brown crab, and sea trout with apple, beetroot and smoked mussels.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Aled Williams pull out all the stops with their main courses: Welsh black beef with leek and potato terrine, loin and shoulder of hogget with morels, and lamb four ways with salt-baked celeriac.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from Wales - Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Aled Williams - pull out all the stops with their desserts: lemon verbena baked custard, mint mousse with hazelnut biscuit and beetroot parfait with chocolate and raspberry brownie.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: This is where it gets tough, as only one chef can make through to the finals and get the chance to cook at this year's banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is going to come out victorious?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Daniel Clifford, Richard Bainbridge and Will Holland launch their culinary assault with the starters: braised hog's head with apple sorbet, white onion soup with roasted muntjac, and rabbit and smoked bacon salad.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Daniel Clifford, Richard Bainbridge and Will Holland are all out to impress with their fish dishes: crab in barley soup with smoked oyster, hay baked rainbow trout and beetroot cured sea trout.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Daniel Clifford, Richard Bainbridge and Will Holland square off in the battle of the main courses. So which dish will get top marks: pigeon and rabbit with carrot terrine, lamb with purple sprouting broccoli or lamb with asparagus crown?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the chefs from the central region to prove they've got what it takes to cook at the banquet. So which dessert will it be, heather honey custard with rhubarb, queen of puddings or lavender junket with mead jelly?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The gloves are off, as only one chef can make through to the finals and get the chance to cook at the banquet. Who is going to come out fighting?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three of the most exciting talents from London and the South East region are competing for a place in the national finals. Head chef Mark Froydenlund runs Marcus Wareing's two star restaurant. Russell Bateman is head Chef at The Grove in Hertfordshire and Ronnie Murray who heads up the Hix Restaurant group.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the fish course and chef Russell Bateman is celebrating the diversity of his beloved home town of London - by combining lobster with jerk spices for an ambitious fish course with seven key elements. Ronnie Murray's taking a risk with an ingredient which is close to the veteran judge's heart and is planning to serve it at three different temperatures, warm, deep fried and frozen. And two Michelin-starred Mark Froydenlund is planning a novel way to present his dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the all-important main course and returning contender Mark Froydenlund is banking on it being his strongest dish. Russell Bateman is creating a beef dish, and Ronnie Murray's mixing a crown of lamb with a curried filling.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the dessert course and the final chance for three of London and South East's most competitive and talented chefs to get through to the judging chamber, today the veteran judge will send one chef home.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the head to head and the two highest scoring chefs from the London and South East region are cooking for judges Oliver Peyton, Prue Leith and Matthew Fort. Joining this week as guest judge is Kevin Gould, an award-winning food writer.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: They kick things off with their starters, but which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be a wild rabbit with ham hock, carrots, asparagus and morels; wild rabbit with a baby leaf salad, black pudding, crispy quail's egg, broad beans and a shot of real ale; or warm pork and apple pie with chilled tomato soup, Yorkshire cheeses and homemade pickle?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: line-caught North Sea mackerel with gooseberries; pickled shellfish and wood smoked crispy prawns with the `smell of the sea'; and smoked trout soup with beetroot, cucumber and oyster nuggets.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Kenny Atkinson, Tim Bilton and Lee Bennett are determined to win but which dish will take first place? Will it be roe deer with beetroot, cauliflower and sage; venison three ways with English garden vegetables; or braised feather blade of beef and Yorkshire pudding with beer and onion gravy?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Which dessert will earn top marks? Strawberry jelly crumble with elderflower custard; a `Best of British' dessert plate - bread and butter pudding, rhubarb and custard, curd tart and strawberries and cream; or brandy snap with cider brandy cream, basil sorbet and summer fruits?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only one chef can make it through to the finals to represent the North East and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is going to come out on top?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All the Northern Irish chefs want the honour of cooking for HRH Prince of Wales. They kick things off with their starters, but which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be quail with asparagus, pork terrine with liver mousse, or slow-cooked pork belly with peas, morels and wild garlic? Former champion Richard Corrigan will decide.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Derek Creagh, Brian McCann and Niall McKenna pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: black sole fillet with crab; seared hand dived scallops and shellfish with seaweed butter.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs from Northern Ireland battle it out with their main courses. Derek Creagh, Brian McCann and Niall McKenna are determined to win, but which dish will take pole position? Will it be loin of lamb, rack of lamb with slow-cooked shoulder or fillet of Shorthorn beef with bone marrow?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Derek Creagh, Brian McCann and Niall McKenna deliver their desserts but which dish will earn top marks; strawberry and elderflower jelly with doughnuts and duck egg ice cream, poached rhubarb with lavender ice cream or brandy strawberry parfait with basil ice cream?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only one chef can make it through to the finals to represent Northern Ireland and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales, but who is going to come out on top?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the national finals of `Great British Menu'. Before cooking starts the eight champions are called to London's Southbank to get a sight of the prize, the chance to cook at a banquet held at the Palace of Westminster, in celebration of everyday Great Britons honoured by the Queen. It has a huge impact on every one of the chefs, each is determined to do all he can to get a dish to the banquet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's day two of the national finals, and the eight champions cook their fish courses. This year's challenge has been to produce dishes that are a lasting legacy to the New Elizabethan Age. They must showcase the transformation in British cuisine during the Queen's historic 64 year reign.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is main course day, the one course every chef wants to cook at the banquet. Judging the chefs' dishes are Matthew Fort, Prue Leith and Oliver Peyton and guest judge John Williams MBE, executive chef of The Ritz.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the final day of the competition, and the last chance for the eight champions to get one of their dishes to the banquet for Queen Elizabeth ll's Great Britons. Judges Matthew Fort, Prue Leith and Oliver Peyton will judge the dessert course and then decide on the banquet menu to be served at the Houses of Parliament. Joining them in the judging chamber is Grace Dent, restaurant critic, journalist and author.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The pressure on the chefs to deliver is immense, and even the Great British Menu judges roll up their sleeves to ensure that the banquet goes according to plan.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Some of the nation's greatest chefs battle for the chance to cook a glittering Olympic banquet. The feast will honour the hopes and achievements of the country's sporting heroes, and it will be a glorious celebration of Britain's culinary talents. This time it is the battle of the Scottish chefs - returning contender Alan Murchison and newcomers Colin Buchan and Mark Greenaway.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning contender Alan Murchison and newcomers Colin Buchan and Mark Greenaway must cook their fish course, but which one will prevail? Will it be grilled mackerel with beetroot meringues and horseradish ice cream, crab `cannelloni' or poached halibut with squid ink? Great British Menu veteran Jeremy Lee will decide who goes through to the judges.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Sir Matthew Pinsent takes time out to meet one of the chefs and give them valuable tips on competing at the highest level. All three chefs are determined to knock out their rivals in the race to the banquet. This is the big one, the main course, but which one will get top marks? Will it be barbecued veal with macaroni cheese, spinach and watercress; beef rump and terrine; or loin of blackface lamb with sweetbreads?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Scottish chefs - returning contender Alan Murchison and newcomers Colin Buchan and Mark Greenaway. All of them are determined to knock out their rivals in the race to the banquet. This is the final chance to impress `Great British Menu' veteran Jeremy Lee with their dessert dishes - `Going for Gold', modern day Eton mess, and beetroot cake with chocolate mousse and fennel ice cream.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is decision time for the chefs from Scotland. The two remaining chefs cook their entire menus for the `Great British Menu' judges, Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. The judges aren't easily pleased and only world class cooking will do. Only one chef can make it through to the national finals to represent Scotland. If they win, one of their dishes could be on the menu at The Olympic Feast.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Central chefs Aktar Islam and Daniel Clifford and newcomer Paul Foster kick things off with their starters, but which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be pork neck with ribwort plantain and pork scratchings, veal tartare with caramelised sweetbread and burnt onions or breast of squab with confit leg and chilli and sweetcorn shoots?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs Aktar Islam, Daniel Clifford and Paul Foster cook their fish course, but which one will prevail? Will it be poached ray wing with chicken skin and sea vegetables, stuffed red mullet with roasted artichoke and parmesan puree, or pickled mackerel with smoked langoustine and infused coconut milk?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs Aktar Islam, Daniel Clifford and Paul Foster cook the big one, the main course, but which one will get top marks? Will it be Goosnargh duck breast and hearts with potatoes cooked in pine, slow poached chicken and sweetcorn egg or coriander crumbed lamb loin with sweetbread bhajis and pea pulao?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the final chance for chefs Aktar Islam, Daniel Clifford and Paul Foster to impress Glynn Purnell as they make their desserts - whipped sea buckthorn with meringue and crispy rice, raspberry and tarragon roulade with cookie dough and tarragon oil, and dark chocolate with raspberry jelly and raspberry sorbet. Plus, paralympian Daniel Greaves offers his advice to one chef.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's decision time for the chefs from the Central region. One chef has already left the competition and only two remain to cook their entire menus for the judges - Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. The judges are not easily pleased and only world class cooking will do. Only one chef can make it through to the national finals to represent the Central region at a glittering Olympic Banquet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: In this battle of the North East chefs, returning contender Stephanie Moon and newcomers Colin McGurran and Charlie Lakin prepare their respective starters. Which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be Stephanie's goat's cheese, Charlie's wild rabbit with carrot and Douglas fir needles, or Colin's quail in the woods?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning contender Stephanie Moon and newcomers Colin McGurran and Charlie Lakin cook their fish course here. Which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be Stephanie's `see food', Charlie's beetroot marinated monkfish with cauliflower and sea radish, or Colin's mullet on the sea bed?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning contender Stephanie Moon and newcomers Colin McGurran and Charlie Lakin cook their main course here. Which one will take gold? Will it be Stephanie's `team spirit re-vealed', Charlie's Dexter beef, Littlebourne snails, marrow bone and wild garlic, or Colin's hay-smoked pig's head with mock apple and textures of onion?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning contender Stephanie Moon and newcomers Colin McGurran and Charlie Lakin have a chance to impress with their dessert dishes. Will it be Stephanie's `podium of puddings', Charlie's Earl Grey and strawberry souffle with gorse flower ice cream, or Colin's chocolate, rhubarb and custard?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's decision time for the chefs from the North East region. One chef left the competition on the previous day and only two remain to cook their entire menus for the `Great British Menu' judges Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. The judges aren't easily pleased and only world-class cooking will do. Who will make it through to the to represent the North East region in the finals.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: In the battle of the Northern Ireland chefs - returning contenders Chris Fearon, Chris Bell and Niall McKenna begin with their starters. Which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be Chris Bell with tea and biscuits, rabbit, black pudding and rhubarb salad; Niall with pig sweetbreads, black truffle and baked onion; or Chris Fearon with clay pigeon shoot?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning contenders Chris Fearon, Chris Bell and Niall McKenna cook their fish course, but which one will prevail? Will it be Chris Bell's red wine poached turbot and bourguignon of snails; Niall's turbot with asparagus, blood orange sauce and rose powder; or Chris Fearon's skate rings?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning contenders Chris Fearon, Chris Bell and Niall McKenna cook their main course here, but which one will take gold? Will it be Chris Bell's roast lissara duck, bakewell tart, cocoa and basil; Niall's dexter beef with miso and fresh almonds; or Chris Fearon's spring jump lamb?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning contenders Chris Fearon, Chris Bell and Niall McKenna present their dessert dishes. Will it be Chris Bell's summer salad of jasmine panna cotta, apricots and pistachio cake; Niall's apple sorbet, elderflower custard and whiskey jelly; or Chris Fearon's the torch? Plus, Olympian Amir Khan gives valuable tips on competing at the highest level.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's decision time for the chefs from the Northern Ireland region. With two chef's remaining, the must cook their entire menus for the `Great British Menu' judges Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. The judges aren't easily pleased and only world-class cooking will do. Just one chef can make it through to the National Finals to represent Northern Ireland.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning contenders Johnnie Mountain and Aiden Byrne along with newcomer Simon Rogan kick things off with their starters. Johnnie makes foie gras ice cream, cherry ravioli and iberico ham; Aiden offers black cherry and foie gras terrine with palm sugar mousse; and Simon's entry is grilled salad, truffle custard, cheese foam and cobnut crisp.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning contenders Johnnie Mountain and Aiden Byrne along with newcomer Simon Rogan present their respective fish courses. Johnnie concocts a Recreation of the Sea; Aiden makes beetroot poached salmon, caviar, razor clam, citrus and fennel salad; and Simon serves up lobster with pickled beetroot, sweet apple and cuckoo flower.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning contenders Johnnie Mountain and Aiden Byrne along with newcomer Simon Rogan are challenged to cook their mains and Marcus Wareing judges the dishes.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning contenders Johnnie Mountain and Aiden Byrne along with newcomer Simon Rogan present their respective desserts. It's the final chance for the chefs to impress veteran Marcus Wareing as he decides who will go through to cook for the judges.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs compete for the chance to cook at a glittering Olympic banquet. The North West finalists go head-to-head as they prepare a lavish meal for judges Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: In the battle of the London and South East chefs newcomers Phil Howard, Graham Garrett and Marcus McGuinness present their starter menus. Will it be Phil with spring salad with goat's milk puree, pickled asparagus and quail's eggs; Graham with pickled rabbit, wild garlic quinoa and frozen rabbit liver parfait; or Marcus with iced lamb's liver parfait, malt loaf, fingerling limes and rose geranium?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Newcomers Phil Howard, Graham Garrett and Marcus McGuinness present their fish courses. Will it be Phil with a tasting of Cornish mackerel with oysters, mussels, winkles and samphire; Marcus with pollock, peas, coconut and elderflower; or Graham with octopus, blood orange, feta cheese, squid ink tuile and black olive salt?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Phil Howard, Graham Garrett and Marcus McGuinness cook their main courses, but only one chef will take gold. Will it be Phil with roast loin of lamb with pie and mash, carrots, nettles and mint; Graham with slow cooked marsh lamb breast, rasher and spiced rissole; or Marcus with blade of beef cooked in hay, tendons and beetroot?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Phil Howard, Graham Garrett and Marcus McGuinness present their dessert dishes here. Will it be Phil with rhubarb and custard souffle, Marcus with asparagus, goat's curd and black olive, or Graham with lemon meringue? Veteran Jason Atherton decides who goes through to the judges and who is going home.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is decision time for the chefs from the London and South East region. The two remaining chefs cook their entire menus for judges Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. The judges aren't easily pleased and only world class cooking will do. The chef's task is to create a menu which captures the Olympic spirit.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the battle of the Wales chefs: returning contenders Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Stephen Terry. All are determined to knock out their rivals in the race to the banquet. Stephen Terry cooks `The Opening Ceremony', Richard Davies makes ravioli of quail, parfait of foie gras, roasted salsify and Madeira jelly, and James Sommerin cooks sage cream, onion, chicken and Welsh `Brie' truffle toast.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Stephen Terry are all determined to knock out their rivals in the race to the banquet. They cook their fish course, but which one will prevail? Will it be Stephen Terry with `The Fish and Shellfish Medley', Richard Davies with compression of vine tomato, poached lobster and hand dived scallop, or James Sommerin with lobster and Iberico ham, spiced butter and broccoli?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Stephen Terry cook their main course, but only one chef will take gold. Will it be Stephen Terry with `The Bunny Pentathlon', Richard Davies with slow cooked rib of beef, beetroot ketchup, bone marrow and braised shallot, or James Sommerin with mangalitsa pork, carrot, liquorice and leek?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Stephen Terry cook their dessert, but who will impress? programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With a refined summer barbecue going up against a traditional Cornish speciality and a historic Wimbledon related recipe, who will come out on top? Andy Clatworthy is using his passion for historical cooking to reinvent a dish.

programme.desc: It's the chefs' final chance to impress the veteran with their dessert dishes. Will it be Paul Ainsworth with `Then and Now'; Nathan Outlaw with elderflower and lemon tart, with strawberry sorbet and meringues; or Simon Hulstone with `Closing Ceremony'?

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips

programme.title: Rocky Mountain Elk Foundation
programme.desc: Part of our responsibility as citizens in this country is to make sure we not only take care of these resources but we hand it off to the next generation in better condition that we found it. -Bob Ziehmer, Senior Director of Conservation for Bass Pro Shops & Cabela's Join Bob in New Mexico as he talks about taking care of our natural resources for future generations. Special thanks to Express UU Bar Ranch

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: We head back to North Dakota for our annual hunting trip and have a few really good days!

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Zach heads back to the homeland to chase ducks and geese in the prairie potholes.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Texas isnt all mesquite flats, corn feeders, and wire fences. Some of the most extreme terrain in the country can be found in the Lone Star State, and it just so happens that hunting opportunities abound for the adventurous.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting head to the Rocky Mountains with Browning Rifles in hand after Wapiti the Native American Term meaning White Rump referring to Elk.

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: Managing a healthy deer herd is part of being a responsible hunter. Stephen, Candice, and Cliff take on the challenge of herd management by focusing on does. Its not just about the huntits about preserving the future. Join them on this important mission and see how its done.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: After a disappointing road trip to Kentucky, Brad Rucks packs his back and heads home for his annual hunt with his daughter.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: We explore the sophisticated world of the whitetail deer's senses, exploring how these remarkable creatures have evolved to pattern hunters through their keen sense of smell and heightened sensory awareness.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Dan Schmidt and Mark Kayser share insights into the natural behavior of whitetail bucks, particularly during the rutting season, and how scrapes play into their territorial and mating behaviors.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Renowned hunter Mark Kayser faces one of his most challenging hunts yet in the sparse woodlands of Nebraska.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Famed Social Media Influencer Leigh McClendon refuses to cave into the pressure of some of his followers who don't support his love of hunting big Whitetail Bucks.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: In this eye-opening episode, Dan Schmidt explores the fascinating science behind a whitetail deer's vision.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: In this eye-opening episode, Dan Schmidt explores the fascinating science behind a whitetail deer's vision.

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: With the Spring of 23 Turkey Seasons still in full swing and tags still left to fill I wanted to rerelease the best of turkey season past. The beginning clips shows the 2020 Single Season Archery Grand Slam in 38 Days! The second clips are my attempt to repeat in 2021!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: Low turkey numbers and a few trespassers made this season tougher than normal. John hits a couple states in pursuit of a few gobblers, but ends up not punching his last tag for a reason that is not to common and often not discussed in conservation circles.

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: Never in a million years did I think I would be in Spain, much less hunting An opportunity to chase true 100% Balerian Goats on the island of Mallorca presented itself after the 2023 season was already planned and set in motion. What do you? You make every effort to make it happen! Logistics, flight delays, and language barriers turned a 4 day hunt into 2. Witnessing their conservation efforts was definitely the highlight of the trip. Although different, it very much works for them and something others could learn from as we hunt to protect these species. Saddle up for a wild 2 days!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: When Under Armour became the Title Sponsor of the Tactical Games, well. I actually learned what the Tactical Games were. Kinda cross fit, kinda strong man all mixed with AR and pistol shooting. Ok, Sign me up!! But what did I just sign up for?! I was about to find out!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: In this episode, John returns to Colorado and looks to connect with another archery velvet mule deer. With a great week of weather ahead, there should be plenty of stalk opportunities!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: An unusually warm Iowa November led John to hunting clover food plots and a bit of deja vu. A buck John passed several times in 2022 would resurface on the same plot, and walk the same path as he did exactly 1 year prior to the day, only 30 mins off. Do you believe deer will repeat themselves? This episode might make you think so!!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: With the Iowa Late Muzzleloader season almost over and a thick snow covering, hopes of filling one more tag were up in the air. A second chance at redemption was offered on an awesome 6.5 year old Iowa buck. Cold temps, food plots, and a favorable wind can be just the things needed to fill a late season tag.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: The Road Trips crew is back in Nebraska and ready to kick off the 2023 deer season. Bryan Brown, Michael Pitts, Ben McDonald and Pastor Brent Purvis are ready to put boots on the ground with Shawn Heyden to locate some shooter bucks for opening day. Be sure to like and subscribe to our channel as we follow the guys daily during the opening week.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: After multiple close encounters on the first day of the season, Tyler Jordan decides to try a different farm and let his little brother tag along. A few early gobbles were heard in the distance, but the action didn't heat up until later in the morning when Tyler struck a couple birds close to the property line. They set up quickly, and in no time, turkeys were in their lap. A perfect shot by Colton and a quick switch of the Franchi was all it took. Two birds with one gun. The Georgia opening weekend was a success.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell sit down to discuss the week No. 1 ups and downs, and what they learned during their first run hunting public ducks up north.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: The crew needed a weather change to get the bucks on their feet before shooting light ended in Nebraska. They got their wish. Highs in the 100's changed to highs in the 60's and sustained 30 MPH winds! Check out Pitts' 5th day hunt for the target buck he's been after all week!

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan hosts Turkeys For Tomorrow (TFT) hunt sweepstakes winner Troy Martin from Kentucky on a hunt at Realtree Farms. The morning started off good with warmer temperatures and multiple turkeys gobbling on the roost. After setting up in the hardwoods on the edge of a field, a few longbeards pitch down and come straight to the call. It results in a quick hunt on a beautiful morning. Also, covered are bay boats and their versatility for families exploring Floridas coastal waterways, along with a detailed study of fish species and wildlife in the region. programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: On this trip, Mark finds himself in Eastern Colorado looking for a big mature Mule Deer. Eastern Colorado is known for some of the best spot and stalk Mule Deer hunting in the US. With the rut in full swing, seeing bucks isn't usually a problem. But getting in range of a big mature buck can be a challenge. Mark spots the mature deer he wants to pursue and spends all of his time trying to get.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is in for an adrenaline-packed adventure in Croatia as he targets the elusive Kri Kri Ibex and Mouflon. With expert guides and unwavering determination, Mark navigates rugged terrain and thrilling hunts, showcasing the excitement and skill of the hunting industry.As his time in Croatia winds down, the episode captures the essence of ethical practices and the intense pursuit that defines this exhilarating sport. Dont miss the epic conclusion to Marks expedition, where passion, skill, and the thrill of the hunt converge in unforgettable moments.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson heads North to Alberta on a late season Elk hunt. This is a very unique hunt where Mark has an Alberta Ministers tag which means 100% of the revenue from this tag goes back to the province of Alberta to fund conservation program studies for Elk, Bighorn Sheep and Mule deer. This is a great program that gives back to the wildlife.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson continues his quest on the Hearst Ranch in California. Next up on the list, California Aoudad. These Aoudad were introduced to the ranch in the early 1920s and have thrived ever since.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson heads south to Florida after an alligator. On this adventure, Mark is toting his Gunwerks BlastR handgun as he hunts the swamps with his sights set on a big mature gator. Alligators are typically judged in the field by looking at the distance from their eyes to the tip of their nose. The rule of thumb is that they grow a foot in length every year until they are eight years old, then grown an inch per year after that. At 13 feet 3 inches, this old gator is one for the books.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Accompany Mark Peterson on his ongoing expedition through California, where he pursues the elusive Tule Elk. Notably, the elk inhabiting this region underwent reclassification from Roosevelt to Tule elk in 2023. Recalling his previous hunt in 2019 with his rifle, Mark is now equipped with his Gunwerks Muzzleloader and he endeavors to achieve optimal proximity for a successful encounter.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is still in Florida and looking for gator number two. After being successful on the morning hunt with his Gunwerks, Mark adds the AMS big game bowfishing kit to his Mathews and heads back out to the swamps in search of his first gator with a bow. It took a few shots to get dialed in, but he eventually connected with gator number two on this trip to the sunshine state.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is kicking off his North America Deer Slam in the great state of Michigan. Mark cut his teeth in Michigan chasing Whitetails with his dad ever since he was able to walk. Starting this new project focused on deer, it only made sense to launch in his home state of Michigan. With the leaves changing and the rut heating up, Mark hops into one of his favorite stands right off his driveway to try his luck chasing a big Michigan Whitetail.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark and his dogs travel West to Nebraska to hunt free range Pheasants with his dad Earl. Mark and Earl are hosted by Worldwide Trophy Adventures CEO Ryan Watchorn. The group spends two days getting after a limit of pheasants while also getting Ryans son his first bird.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark's quest for the South America Waterfowl Slam has now taken him to Peru where he finds a surprising density of Cinnamon Teal. Although he already checked this species off the list in Argentina, his first hunt in Peru proves to be one of the best Cinnamon Teal shoots of his life. This is only the first afternoon and there are 5 days left to hunt the remaining 7 species.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: In this episode, Mark Peterson chases after a Red Stag, Black Buck and Fallow deer. Theres no shortage of action in this video. Argentina's borders were closed during the peak of COVID, so these animals have not been hunted for two years, which led to a game rich environment and excellent trophy quality. On this adventure, Mark is joined by his dad Earl, brother Aaron and nephew Alec to chase some of the biggest free-range Red Stags in the world. Stay tuned for more on this family adventure in Argentina.

programme.title: Upland Slam
programme.desc: In Part 4, Mark Peterson ventures to South Dakota for prairie chickens and sharp-tailed grouse. South Dakota is well known as the pheasant hunting capital of the world, but with its rolling prairie lands, also holds great habitat and numbers of prairie chicken and sharp-tail grouse. Take a look as Mark chases both and find out if he connects.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin entices a friend to play hooky from work to set hooks offshore on a perfect locals day. The only thing better than the weather was the dinner they caught and cooked.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Witness a truly epic day on the water when Capt. Justin and Meredith find a secluded slice of beach teeming with redfish biting virtually everything. Topwater plugs, rusty flies and a live well full of bait make for an experience no redfish angler would forget

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When your gut tells you to do something different than whats in front of you, do you listen?Capt. Justin and Meredith listen, and find that success comes in many forms. And it turns out that success can be really tasty, too!

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Its opening day of grouper season and, for Capt. Justin Leake and one of his longtime fishing buddies, that means a trip offshore is in order. And what better way to break in a new boat than heading to some reefs and filling the cooler with one of the Gulf of Mexicos most popular fish?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Theres nothing like a change in weather conditions to wreck a perfectly good fishing plan, and thats exactly what Capt. Justin Leake and his cousin encounter when December turns unseasonably warm. Its a grey morning with thick fog so Justin and Capt. Brent Berry wont be heading offshore right away as planned. Instead, Justin turns to his Humminbird CoastMaster charts to pinpoint a near shore artificial reef just five minutes from the St. Andrews Pass, where the anglers will do a little fishing until the fog burns off. Capt. Leake opts to send a jig to the bottom and hes not very picky about the one that gets tied on. When fishing reefs, the specific jig doesnt matter because its all about the presentation, he says. When youre sitting on top of a wreck, break out the junk jigs they get bit just fine. And that proves to be the case as Justin and Brent enjoy non-stop battles against amberjack, red snapper and bonita. And with a bite this good, theres no reason to go anywhere else! Also, we take a look at the United States Coast Guard Auxiliarys new paddle craft safety initiative.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: We return to the Ellie B and head a hundred miles offshore to repeat last years epic tuna bite. But someone must have brought a banana on board because the plan suddenly turned into an unexpected adventure.

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: Low turkey numbers and a few trespassers made this season tougher than normal. John hits a couple states in pursuit of a few gobblers, but ends up not punching his last tag for a reason that is not to common and often not discussed in conservation circles.

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: Never in a million years did I think I would be in Spain, much less hunting An opportunity to chase true 100% Balerian Goats on the island of Mallorca presented itself after the 2023 season was already planned and set in motion. What do you? You make every effort to make it happen! Logistics, flight delays, and language barriers turned a 4 day hunt into 2. Witnessing their conservation efforts was definitely the highlight of the trip. Although different, it very much works for them and something others could learn from as we hunt to protect these species. Saddle up for a wild 2 days!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: When Under Armour became the Title Sponsor of the Tactical Games, well. I actually learned what the Tactical Games were. Kinda cross fit, kinda strong man all mixed with AR and pistol shooting. Ok, Sign me up!! But what did I just sign up for?! I was about to find out!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: In this episode, John returns to Colorado and looks to connect with another archery velvet mule deer. With a great week of weather ahead, there should be plenty of stalk opportunities!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: An unusually warm Iowa November led John to hunting clover food plots and a bit of deja vu. A buck John passed several times in 2022 would resurface on the same plot, and walk the same path as he did exactly 1 year prior to the day, only 30 mins off. Do you believe deer will repeat themselves? This episode might make you think so!!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: With the Iowa Late Muzzleloader season almost over and a thick snow covering, hopes of filling one more tag were up in the air. A second chance at redemption was offered on an awesome 6.5 year old Iowa buck. Cold temps, food plots, and a favorable wind can be just the things needed to fill a late season tag.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: The Road Trips crew is back in Nebraska and ready to kick off the 2023 deer season. Bryan Brown, Michael Pitts, Ben McDonald and Pastor Brent Purvis are ready to put boots on the ground with Shawn Heyden to locate some shooter bucks for opening day. Be sure to like and subscribe to our channel as we follow the guys daily during the opening week.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: After multiple close encounters on the first day of the season, Tyler Jordan decides to try a different farm and let his little brother tag along. A few early gobbles were heard in the distance, but the action didn't heat up until later in the morning when Tyler struck a couple birds close to the property line. They set up quickly, and in no time, turkeys were in their lap. A perfect shot by Colton and a quick switch of the Franchi was all it took. Two birds with one gun. The Georgia opening weekend was a success.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell sit down to discuss the week No. 1 ups and downs, and what they learned during their first run hunting public ducks up north.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: The crew needed a weather change to get the bucks on their feet before shooting light ended in Nebraska. They got their wish. Highs in the 100's changed to highs in the 60's and sustained 30 MPH winds! Check out Pitts' 5th day hunt for the target buck he's been after all week!

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan hosts Turkeys For Tomorrow (TFT) hunt sweepstakes winner Troy Martin from Kentucky on a hunt at Realtree Farms. The morning started off good with warmer temperatures and multiple turkeys gobbling on the roost. After setting up in the hardwoods on the edge of a field, a few longbeards pitch down and come straight to the call. It results in a quick hunt on a beautiful morning. To become a member of TFT, and to support its many conservation efforts to ensure we have healthy turkeys populations in the future, click the link below.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell meet a new friend at the boat ramp. The group teams up in the timber. Then, an afternoon scouting trip pays off as the pair finds new water and new ducks.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: This week's episode takes place at the famed Honey Brake in Louisiana. Drake White kicks things off with a big 8-pointer, capping off an amazing comeback story for him. Riley Green continues his hot streak and takes a target buck. Finally, Tyler Jordan rounds out the incredible trip with his best buck ever. It's a giant typical.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell are working their day jobs, but they're also reflecting on duck season. Duck season is a couple months away, but it'll be here soon.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan hunts one of the biggest bucks on Realtree Farms with his brother Colton. Colton and his Dad Bill, have seen this buck several times over the last few days not he and Tyler make a move hoping to get Colton a shot at this giant Georgia whitetail.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh and George from Two Georges Marina battle the wind and tide on a tough day of fishing which leads Josh to fish another day, solely for revenge on the Sheepshead!

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Join Captain Josh and Sheriff Eric Aden for a day of fishing and fun in Destin, Florida. These two friends hit the water, catching fish both offshore and inshore, and reeling in some impressive catches. With plenty of laughs, great stories, and a few surprises along the way, this episode is all about the joy of fishing and the bond between two guys who love the sea.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Join Josh Calhoon on Goin Coastal TV as he takes Big Gus on one of the most epic topwater bites ever caught on camera!

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: In the thrilling season finale of "Goin' Coastal," host Josh Calhoon takes his daughter, Lily, on an unforgettable birthday fishing adventure in Destin, Florida. They target mighty amberjack, battling these fierce fighters, when Lily hooks into a surprising Goliath grouper, leading to an epic showdown. This heartwarming and action-packed episode captures the essence of family, the thrill of the catch, and the beauty of coastal living. Don't miss this special finale filled with love, laughter, and coastal charm.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing and the marine industry, we are often more united by the Bluefin tuna than we think. For Ali Hussainy, the Bluefin is responsible for fueling his life long passion as an angler, and in this episode he gets to share that passion with two friends that have their own ties to the species. For wildlife biologist Forrest Galante and master sushi chef Hiroyuki Terada, catching a bluefin tuna on rod and reel will be a first!

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: Host Ryan McVinney takes Boat Trader fans on an indepth exploration of Florida flats fishing deep in the backcountry of Islamorada. Featuring Captain Eric Lund, a Wall Street Broker turned backcountry fishing guide, this episode reveals the key design features of the worlds best flats skiffs and how they are built for targeting some of the most exciting sportfish species on the planet. Also, covered are bay boats and their versatility for families exploring Floridas coastal waterways, along with a detailed study of fish species and wildlife in the region. Some of the areas most beautiful and secret locales show why Islamorada has earned the nickname of the Sportfish Capital of The World.
