programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: John heads back to Kentucky once again!! After moving away in 2016, John hasnt connected on a KY buck since! If it could go wrong, it went wrong! But, optimism is high this year on a new piece of property his buddy from high school just bought! Short window to get this hunt in before the western swing kicks in too! Can he get it done and break the bad luck?

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Accompany Mark Peterson on his ongoing expedition through California, where he pursues the elusive Tule Elk. Notably, the elk inhabiting this region underwent reclassification from Roosevelt to Tule elk in 2023. Recalling his previous hunt in 2019 with his rifle, Mark is now equipped with his Gunwerks Muzzleloader and he endeavors to achieve optimal proximity for a successful encounter.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson continues his quest on the Hearst Ranch in California. Next up on the list, California Aoudad. These Aoudad were introduced to the ranch in the early 1920s and have thrived ever since.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: On this trip, Mark finds himself in Eastern Colorado looking for a big mature Mule Deer. Eastern Colorado is known for some of the best spot and stalk Mule Deer hunting in the US. With the rut in full swing, seeing bucks isn't usually a problem. But getting in range of a big mature buck can be a challenge. Mark spots the mature deer he wants to pursue and spends all of his time trying to get.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is in for an adrenaline-packed adventure in Croatia as he targets the elusive Kri Kri Ibex and Mouflon. With expert guides and unwavering determination, Mark navigates rugged terrain and thrilling hunts, showcasing the excitement and skill of the hunting industry.As his time in Croatia winds down, the episode captures the essence of ethical practices and the intense pursuit that defines this exhilarating sport. Dont miss the epic conclusion to Marks expedition, where passion, skill, and the thrill of the hunt converge in unforgettable moments.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson heads North to Alberta on a late season Elk hunt. This is a very unique hunt where Mark has an Alberta Ministers tag which means 100% of the revenue from this tag goes back to the province of Alberta to fund conservation program studies for Elk, Bighorn Sheep and Mule deer. This is a great program that gives back to the wildlife.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson continues his quest on the Hearst Ranch in California. Next up on the list, California Aoudad. These Aoudad were introduced to the ranch in the early 1920s and have thrived ever since.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson heads south to Florida after an alligator. On this adventure, Mark is toting his Gunwerks BlastR handgun as he hunts the swamps with his sights set on a big mature gator. Alligators are typically judged in the field by looking at the distance from their eyes to the tip of their nose. The rule of thumb is that they grow a foot in length every year until they are eight years old, then grown an inch per year after that. At 13 feet 3 inches, this old gator is one for the books.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Accompany Mark Peterson on his ongoing expedition through California, where he pursues the elusive Tule Elk. Notably, the elk inhabiting this region underwent reclassification from Roosevelt to Tule elk in 2023. Recalling his previous hunt in 2019 with his rifle, Mark is now equipped with his Gunwerks Muzzleloader and he endeavors to achieve optimal proximity for a successful encounter.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is still in Florida and looking for gator number two. After being successful on the morning hunt with his Gunwerks, Mark adds the AMS big game bowfishing kit to his Mathews and heads back out to the swamps in search of his first gator with a bow. It took a few shots to get dialed in, but he eventually connected with gator number two on this trip to the sunshine state.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is kicking off his North America Deer Slam in the great state of Michigan. Mark cut his teeth in Michigan chasing Whitetails with his dad ever since he was able to walk. Starting this new project focused on deer, it only made sense to launch in his home state of Michigan. With the leaves changing and the rut heating up, Mark hops into one of his favorite stands right off his driveway to try his luck chasing a big Michigan Whitetail.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark and his dogs travel West to Nebraska to hunt free range Pheasants with his dad Earl. Mark and Earl are hosted by Worldwide Trophy Adventures CEO Ryan Watchorn. The group spends two days getting after a limit of pheasants while also getting Ryans son his first bird.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark's quest for the South America Waterfowl Slam has now taken him to Peru where he finds a surprising density of Cinnamon Teal. Although he already checked this species off the list in Argentina, his first hunt in Peru proves to be one of the best Cinnamon Teal shoots of his life. This is only the first afternoon and there are 5 days left to hunt the remaining 7 species.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: In this episode, Mark Peterson chases after a Red Stag, Black Buck and Fallow deer. Theres no shortage of action in this video. Argentina's borders were closed during the peak of COVID, so these animals have not been hunted for two years, which led to a game rich environment and excellent trophy quality. On this adventure, Mark is joined by his dad Earl, brother Aaron and nephew Alec to chase some of the biggest free-range Red Stags in the world. Stay tuned for more on this family adventure in Argentina.

programme.title: Upland Slam
programme.desc: In Part 4, Mark Peterson ventures to South Dakota for prairie chickens and sharp-tailed grouse. South Dakota is well known as the pheasant hunting capital of the world, but with its rolling prairie lands, also holds great habitat and numbers of prairie chicken and sharp-tail grouse. Take a look as Mark chases both and find out if he connects.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin entices a friend to play hooky from work to set hooks offshore on a perfect locals day. The only thing better than the weather was the dinner they caught and cooked.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Witness a truly epic day on the water when Capt. Justin and Meredith find a secluded slice of beach teeming with redfish biting virtually everything. Topwater plugs, rusty flies and a live well full of bait make for an experience no redfish angler would forget

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When your gut tells you to do something different than whats in front of you, do you listen?Capt. Justin and Meredith listen, and find that success comes in many forms. And it turns out that success can be really tasty, too!

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Its opening day of grouper season and, for Capt. Justin Leake and one of his longtime fishing buddies, that means a trip offshore is in order. And what better way to break in a new boat than heading to some reefs and filling the cooler with one of the Gulf of Mexicos most popular fish?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Theres nothing like a change in weather conditions to wreck a perfectly good fishing plan, and thats exactly what Capt. Justin Leake and his cousin encounter when December turns unseasonably warm. Its a grey morning with thick fog so Justin and Capt. Brent Berry wont be heading offshore right away as planned. Instead, Justin turns to his Humminbird CoastMaster charts to pinpoint a near shore artificial reef just five minutes from the St. Andrews Pass, where the anglers will do a little fishing until the fog burns off. Capt. Leake opts to send a jig to the bottom and hes not very picky about the one that gets tied on. When fishing reefs, the specific jig doesnt matter because its all about the presentation, he says. When youre sitting on top of a wreck, break out the junk jigs they get bit just fine. And that proves to be the case as Justin and Brent enjoy non-stop battles against amberjack, red snapper and bonita. And with a bite this good, theres no reason to go anywhere else! Also, we take a look at the United States Coast Guard Auxiliarys new paddle craft safety initiative.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: We return to the Ellie B and head a hundred miles offshore to repeat last years epic tuna bite. But someone must have brought a banana on board because the plan suddenly turned into an unexpected adventure.

programme.desc: An ancient mummy returns from the dead and becomes obsessed with a woman he believes is his dead lover.

programme.desc: A small town basketball star wins an athletic scholarship, but soon learns his challenges have only begun.

programme.title: Stroker Ace
programme.desc: A winning NASCAR driver is forced to accept an onerous contract from a fried chicken magnate.

programme.title: The Adventures of Pluto Nash
programme.desc: In the year 2087, a bold casino owner, his android bodyguard and a beautiful, aspiring singer are on the run from a millionaire gangster on the moon.

programme.title: Black Beauty
programme.desc: The classic story of a courageous horse who faced enemies and natural disasters, all while seeing the best and worst of humanity.

programme.title: Hamlet (1996)
programme.desc: Kenneth Branagh leads an all-star cast in an adaptation of Shakespeare's great tragedy - the story of Hamlet.

programme.title: El Cantante
programme.desc: This powerful film tells the tumultuous life story of Puerto Rican singer Hctor Lavoe, whose voice brought salsa music to the world.

programme.title: We Are Your Friends
programme.desc: A rising DJ grapples with complex relationships after falling for his mentor's girlfriend, leaving him to choose between love, loyalty, and music.

programme.title: Imagine: John Lennon
programme.desc: A film documenting John Lennon's profound impact on the world via footage shot during Lennon's life.

programme.title: Elvis: That's The Way It Is (Special Edition)
programme.desc: This feature-length concert film crosses the footlights to reveal the King of Rock and Rolls triumphant 1970 return to the stage in Las Vegas.

programme.title: Local Hero
programme.desc: In one of Scotlands best-ever comedies, an oil tycoon sends a man to an odd, enchanting coastal town to grab land rights, but nothing goes as planned.

programme.title: The Island Of Dr. Moreau
programme.desc: A brilliant, deranged scientist performs genetic experiments melding humans and animalswith horrific results.

programme.title: Clara's Heart
programme.desc: A Jamaican woman teaches a boy from the Maryland suburbs about life, while his self-absorbed parents grieve over the death of their other child.

programme.title: Deathtrap
programme.desc: Sidney Bruhl's latest whodunit is a failure. Only a new smash hit can salvage his reputation and pride, but Sidney is out of ideas.

programme.title: Guilty by Suspicion
programme.desc: A film director faces the House Committee on Un-American Activities and political turmoil in 1950s America.

programme.title: Bed Of Roses
programme.desc: When a New York City florist sends flowers to a grief-stricken financier, he initiates an unlikely romance.

programme.title: Geronimo: An American Legend
programme.desc: Following the expansion of the United States into the Southwest, the Apache Indians are forced onto a reservation to live out their lives as lowly corn farmers. While many resign themselves to this fate, several Apache, including Geronimo (Wes Studi), refuse to go quietly. Hoping to quell a major rebellion, General Charles Crook (Gene Hackman) dispatches over 5,000 U.S. Cavalry soldiers, led by Lieutenant Charles Gatewood (Jason Patric), to hunt down Geronimo and his men.

programme.title: A Perfect Day
programme.desc: An author discovers fame when his book skyrockets to the bestseller list. He then gets a visit from a stranger telling him he has 40 days to live.

programme.title: Buster & Chauncey's Silent Night
programme.desc: Two 19th-century Austrian mice evade a voracious cat, aid a kidnapped orphan, foil thieves and help create a holiday classic.

programme.title: I'll Do Anything
programme.desc: Character actor Matt Hobbs finds himself struggling to make ends meet when his ex-wife unexpectedly makes him responsible for their 6-year-old kid.

programme.title: Lost in Yonkers
programme.desc: A film adaptation of Neil Simon's Pulitzer Prize-winning comedy/drama that follows the escapades and tragedies of an unusual family in 1942 Yonkers.

programme.title: The 12 Dogs of Christmas
programme.desc: During the Great Depression in a town that has outlawed dogs, a preteen girl puts on a canine-themed Christmas pageant to win over the mayor.

programme.title: The Nuttiest Nutcracker
programme.desc: Young teen Marie falls asleep and enters the magical world of the Nutcracker Prince where, along with some friends, she helps him reclaim his kingdom.

programme.title: Buster & Chauncey's Silent Night
programme.desc: Two 19th-century Austrian mice evade a voracious cat, aid a kidnapped orphan, foil thieves and help create a holiday classic.

programme.title: Christmas on Division Street
programme.desc: Follows the unlikely friendship between a bullied teenage school boy and the unhomed American history buff he wants to help before Christmas.

programme.title: The 12 Dogs of Christmas
programme.desc: During the Great Depression in a town that has outlawed dogs, a preteen girl puts on a canine-themed Christmas pageant to win over the mayor.

programme.title: Emma's Chance
programme.desc: While doing community service at a horse rescue ranch, a girl forms an unlikely bond with an abused stallion that will not let anyone else ride him.

programme.title: Little Secrets
programme.desc: A pre-teen violin virtuoso tries to fund her dreams by setting up a booth in her backyard where she hears and keeps young peoples deepest secrets.

programme.title: Passionada
programme.desc: When a widowed mother refuses to date even years after her husband's death, her daughter Vicky sets out on a quest to find romance for her mom.

programme.title: The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: After bounty hunter Milo learns that his next target is his ex-wife Nicole, the two become entangled in a contentious web of games.

programme.title: Guarding Tess
programme.desc: A cantankerous, beloved former First Lady, whose husband died in office, uses her extraordinary intelligence in a battle of wills with her bodyguard.

programme.title: Peggy Sue Got Married
programme.desc: An unhappy woman named Peggy Sue tries to change her future when she inadvertently travels back in time to her senior year of high school.

programme.title: Ice Castles
programme.desc: This remake of the 1979 film finds Alexis on the cusp of figure skating stardom when an accident on the ice takes her sight, but not her courage.

programme.title: Apple of My Eye
programme.desc: When a riding accident causes a teenage equestrian to lose her eyesight, a miniature horse named Apple is trained to be her seeing eye companion.

programme.title: Finding Graceland
programme.desc: A grieving and guilt-ridden recent widower finds himself on a road trip to Memphis after picking up a hitchhiker who claims hes Elvis Presley.

programme.title: The Incredible Journey of Doctor Meg Laurel
programme.desc: An intrepid young doctor returns to her roots to open a practice in Appalachia, where her modern medicine clashes with the locals home-spun remedies.

programme.title: I Walk the Line
programme.desc: A sheriff falls in love with a teen whose father is a moonshiner, and falls in danger when as a result, accidentally becomes an accomplice to murder.

programme.title: Runaway
programme.desc: A futuristic cop who works on broken robots discovers a plan to program them with artificial intelligence for murder, with his own son on the list.

programme.title: Masterminds
programme.desc: A tech geek expelled from school for pulling pranks on staff becomes the one person with enough savvy to rescue students from a gang of kidnappers.

programme.title: Crazy in Alabama
programme.desc: Lucille, is an eccentric who goes to Hollywood to pursue her dreams. In tow is her nephew, Peejoe, an Alabama boy who's about to get a fast education.

programme.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
programme.desc: Adaptation of the Pierre Bouelle novel about POWs in Burma forced to build a bridge to aid the war effort of their Japanese captors. British and American officers plot to blow up the structure, but the commander of the bridge's construction has different plans.

programme.title: On the Waterfront
programme.desc: Dockworker Terry Malloy (Marlon Brando) had been an up-and-coming boxer until powerful local mob boss Johnny Friendly (Lee J. Cobb) persuaded him to throw a fight. When a longshoreman is murdered before he can testify about Friendly's control of the Hoboken waterfront, Terry teams up with the dead man's sister Edie (Eva Marie Saint) and the streetwise priest Father Barry (Karl Malden) to testify himself, against the advice of Friendly's lawyer, Terry's older brother Charley (Rod Steiger).

programme.title: Girls Can Play
programme.desc: A detective investigates the murder of a player on a professional girl's softball team.

programme.title: The Goddess
programme.desc: As a child, she was Emily Ann, a poor girl in the South with no friends and an ineffective mother. But as an adult, she's Rita Shawn (Kim Stanley), an actress loved the world over. Still, all the money and fame in the world can't buy happiness, and Rita is plagued with depression over her broken relationships -- first to a handsome soldier (Steve Hill) and then to a boxing promoter (Lloyd Bridges) -- and her lack of any emotional connections to anyone outside of her professional life.

programme.title: Hamlet
programme.desc: The prince's quest for revenge becomes his undoing when his suspicion is confirmed that his uncle killed his father to win the throne and his mother.

programme.title: All the Young Men
programme.desc: After taking command of a Marine platoon during the Korean War, a Black sergeant struggles to rally the white soldiers to complete a critical mission.

programme.title: The Devil at 4 O'Clock
programme.desc: After a volcano erupts on a South Sea island, a fallen priest and three convicts race to save the lives of children in a mountaintop leper colony.

programme.title: Oliver Twist
programme.desc: In this adaptation of the classic Charles Dickens novel, an orphan on the streets of London is welcomed into a household of trained pickpockets.

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: The long-standing bond between two small-time smugglers sailing around the Caribbean is threatened when a gorgeous siren seeks passage on their boat.

programme.title: She Played With Fire
programme.desc: An English insurance man (Jack Hawkins) discovers his ex-girlfriend (Arlene Dahl) and her husband's (Dennis Price) art-forgery/arson scam.

programme.title: The Fuller Brush Girl
programme.desc: Fired from her job as a switchboard operator, a daffy young woman tries her hand at door-to-door cosmetics sales only to get mixed up in a murder rap.

programme.title: Hot Blood
programme.desc: A gypsy woman who lives by decamping with marriage settlements from wealthy men meets her match in the handsome younger brother of a gypsy king.

programme.title: Only Angels Have Wings
programme.desc: Rough and tough Geoff Carter (Cary Grant) runs a tiny airline that cannot afford to miss any flights, despite the dangers along many of the routes. When Bonnie Lee (Jean Arthur), a performer who is falling for him, sees that Geoff is preparing to fly in violent weather conditions, she takes measures to make him stay. She's successful in her attempt, and two of his employees are forced to make the flight for him -- but Bonnie may have been correct about the potential peril of that flight.

programme.title: Theodora Goes Wild
programme.desc: Theodora Lynn (Irene Dunne) is secretly the author of a salacious novel written under a pen name. She must hide her identity from the residents of her small, conservative Connecticut town, who disapprove of the book. When Theodora goes to New York to visit her publisher (Thurston Hall), she meets the book's cover artist, Michael Grant (Melvyn Douglas), who tries to convince her to reveal herself as the real author. When Theodora falls for Michael, she soon finds that he has secrets of his own.

programme.title: Her Husband's Affairs
programme.desc: Advertising executive William Weldon (Franchot Tone) narrowly averts career implosion when his clever wife, Margaret (Lucille Ball), helps him save an important advertising account. But tensions run high in the Weldon household after William's fast-talking employer, J.B. Cruikshank (Edward Everett Horton), invites Margaret to work for him too. The cunning couple must compete with each other to write a campaign for Emil Glinka (Mikhail Rasumny) -- a mad scientist with an alarming new product.

programme.title: A Night to Remember
programme.desc: In this suspenseful comedy, Nancy Troy (Loretta Young) and her mystery-author husband, Jeff (Brian Aherne), move into a dark basement apartment in New York City's Greenwich Village, in hopes of stirring up writing inspiration. When their neighbors begin acting oddly and one of them turns up dead, Nancy and Jeff must uncover a murder mystery in their own building, with a number of suspects lurking about, including the creepy Mrs. Devoe (Gale Sondergaard).

programme.title: The Last Hurrah
programme.desc: An aging New England mayor is defeated in a hard-fought reelection campaign involving shady transactions by both political groups.

programme.title: Divorce American Style
programme.desc: A nouveau-riche L.A. couple decide to call it quits after 17 years of marriage, but alimony woes send the bachelor in search of a husband for his ex.

programme.title: Operation Mad Ball
programme.desc: A group of enlisted men, led by Private Hogan, are tasked with planning a dance party, while trying to keep it a secret from a busy-body officer.

programme.title: Gidget Grows Up
programme.desc: When her boyfriend leaves for the Air Force without calling, Gidget heads to New York in the name of world peace and joins the U.N. as a tour guide.

programme.title: First Comes Courage
programme.desc: Beautiful Norwegian woman Nicole Larsen (Merle Oberon) is dedicated to the local resistance movement, and seduces Nazi officer Paul Dichter (Carl Esmond) in order to gain information that will help to defeat the Germans. Complicating matters for Nicole are both the difficulty of her loathsome undercover work and the appearance of an old flame, handsome English soldier Allan Lowell (Brian Aherne), who would like nothing more than to reunite with her.

programme.title: Don't Raise the Bridge, Lower the River
programme.desc: A daydreamer enlists the help of his British con artist friend to steal and sell the plans for a valuable new oil drill in this spy thriller spoof.

programme.title: Holiday
programme.desc: Johnny (Cary Grant) seems like a solid match for Julia (Doris Nolan), the socialite daughter of Edward Seton (Henry Kolker). Assured that Johnny is a worthy suitor, Edward approves of the pairing. But, as Johnny's wanderlust surfaces -- he is more interested in traveling than in business -- Edward starts to have doubts. Johnny also begins to wonder if he might not be a better match for Linda (Katharine Hepburn), Julia's outspoken younger sister, with whom he has much more in common.

programme.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
programme.desc: Adaptation of the Pierre Bouelle novel about POWs in Burma forced to build a bridge to aid the war effort of their Japanese captors. British and American officers plot to blow up the structure, but the commander of the bridge's construction has different plans.

programme.title: The Desperadoes
programme.desc: Sheriff Steve Upton (Randolph Scott) is a devoted lawman who works tirelessly to keep order in his small town, nestled within the Utah territory. So, when Cheyenne Rogers (Glenn Ford), an old friend with a criminal past, rolls into town, Upton is immediately on edge. Cheyenne assures his pal that all that's behind him now. But when the town bank is robbed, Cheyenne becomes the locals' number one suspect. He'll have to prove his innocence to save himself and his friend's reputation.

programme.title: Coroner Creek
programme.desc: A gunfighter (Randolph Scott) loses his beloved in a robbery and hunts the man (George Macready) to blame, who is living off the loot.

programme.title: J.W. Coop
programme.desc: After spending a decade behind bars for writing bad checks and punching a cop, former rodeo star J.W. Coop (Cliff Robertson) re-enters a world drastically different from how he left it; the only constant seems to be his mother (Geraldine Page). Gradually coming to terms with societal changes and cultural norms, Coop is determined to climb back to the top spot on the rodeo circuit. Along the way, he hooks up with Bean (Cristina Ferrare), a liberated woman who helps him catch up to modern life.

programme.title: The Doolins of Oklahoma
programme.desc: Old West outlaw Bill Doolin (Randolph Scott) marries a deacon's wife, but his gang will not leave him alone.

programme.title: Land Raiders
programme.desc: An Arizona land-grabber (Telly Savalas) and his brother (George Maharis) renew their feud amid Army troops and Apaches.

programme.title: Jack McCall, Desperado
programme.desc: A lone gunslinger, Jack McCall (George Montgomery), bursts into a saloon and shoots dead the legendary Wild Bill Hickok (Douglas Kennedy). Arrested and put on trial, McCall recounts a twisted tale that paints Hickok as anything but heroic, explaining how Hickok and McCall's cousin Bat (James Seay) took over McCall's family's plantation, killed his parents and even framed him for crimes he didn't commit. McCall's cold-blooded killing of Hickok was warranted. Or was it?

programme.title: The Nebraskan
programme.desc: When his Indian assistant, Wingfoot (Maurice Jara), is accused of murdering a Sioux chief, Army scout Wade Harper (Phil Carey) brings him to Fort Kearney, Neb., where Colonel Markham (Regis Toomey) insists the young man has the right to a fair trial rather than handing him over to the Sioux. While in jail, Wingfoot is forced to escape with ruthless prisoner Reno Benton (Lee Van Cleef). Wade sets out with a small party to rescue his friend, with the Sioux right behind him.

programme.title: Gun Fury
programme.desc: California-bound rancher Ben Warren (Rock Hudson) is shot and left for dead when a demented ex-Confederate, Frank Slayton (Phil Carey), kidnaps his Southern bride-to-be (Donna Reed). Revived, Ben sets out to rescue her. Along the way, he picks up Jess Burgess (Leo Gordon), a slighted former member of Slayton's gang, and American Indian local Johash (Pat Hogan), who has his own beef with the outlaws. Together they embark on a perilous chase toward the Mexican border to stop Slayton.

programme.title: The Outlaw Stallion
programme.desc: A boy and his mother are kidnapped by outlaws after the boy's stallion kills the outlaw leader's mount.

programme.title: Texas
programme.desc: Confederate soldiers Dan (William Holden) and Tod (Glenn Ford) look to Texas for opportunities when the war ends. Upon witnessing a stagecoach robbery, the close friends ambush the outlaws and confiscate the stolen funds. Tod wishes to return the money, but Dan wants to keep it. After a sheriff gives chase, each man runs off on his own. They are reunited after some time, but with Tod now an honest ranch hand and Dan an outlaw cattle rustler, the two do not know if their friendship can survive.

programme.title: Al Jennings of Oklahoma
programme.desc: Lawyer Al (Dan Duryea) and brother Frank (Dick Foran) turn to robbing banks and trains after Union troops raid their home.

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Four soldiers of fortune are hired by a wealthy rancher to rescue his beautiful young wife who has been kidnapped by a villainous Mexican bandit. When they finally find her, after fighting their way across deserts and mountains, they discover she is not being held against her will. This causes friction within the band as to whether they should honor their agreement.

programme.title: The Untamed Breed
programme.desc: Texas ranchers resist an out-of-towner (Sonny Tufts) who has a Brahman bull to breed.

programme.title: The Quick Gun
programme.desc: A banished gunfighter (Audie Murphy) returns to his sweetheart (Merry Anders) and helps his sheriff friend (James Best) face outlaws.

programme.title: Cowboy
programme.desc: A Chicago hotel clerk smitten with the daughter of a trail bosss business partner goes on a cattle drive with him to Mexico through the real West.

programme.title: J.W. Coop
programme.desc: After spending a decade behind bars for writing bad checks and punching a cop, former rodeo star J.W. Coop (Cliff Robertson) re-enters a world drastically different from how he left it; the only constant seems to be his mother (Geraldine Page). Gradually coming to terms with societal changes and cultural norms, Coop is determined to climb back to the top spot on the rodeo circuit. Along the way, he hooks up with Bean (Cristina Ferrare), a liberated woman who helps him catch up to modern life.

programme.title: The Guns of Fort Petticoat
programme.desc: Texan and U.S. Cavalryman Lt. Frank Hewitt (Audie Murphy) deserts the army after Colorado Union soldiers carry out the deadly Sand Creek reservation massacre, fearing reprisal from the Cheyenne. Crossing into Texas, Franks finds himself labeled a traitor for fighting with the Yankees, and his warnings about possible Indian revenge go unheeded. When a town near a mission, populated mostly by women, is attacked, Frank is appointed their protector and must build an army comprised of townswomen.

programme.title: The Violent Men
programme.desc: Former Union soldier John Parrish (Glenn Ford) wants to sell his ranch and start a new life by settling down out east. However, the ruthless tactics of Lew Wilkison (Edward G. Robinson), the scheming businessman interested in his property, make Parrish reconsider the move, especially after one of his ranch hands is murdered. Adding to the increasingly tense conflict is Wilkison's wife, Martha (Barbara Stanwyck), who is cheating on her husband with his brother, Cole (Brian Keith).

programme.title: Gunmen From Laredo
programme.desc: A framed Texas rancher (Robert Knapp) escapes from prison for a showdown with a saloonkeeper (Walter Coy).

programme.title: Riders of the Northwest Mounted
programme.desc: A Mountie (Russell Hayden) and his partner (Dub Taylor) set out on a manhunt.

programme.title: The Stranger Wore a Gun
programme.desc: After the Civil War, a spy for the Confederacy absconds to Arizona to start a new life but gets reluctantly pulled into a stagecoach gold robbery.

programme.title: Legend of the Golden Gun
programme.desc: After his family is killed, a quiet, young farmer turns into a deadly gunfighter, dedicating his life to the pursuit of evildoers.

programme.title: Oklahoma Crude
programme.desc: An oil derrick owner in early 1900s Oklahoma, along with her father and a bum, tries her best to keep oil companies from buying her estate.

programme.title: The Desperadoes
programme.desc: Sheriff Steve Upton (Randolph Scott) is a devoted lawman who works tirelessly to keep order in his small town, nestled within the Utah territory. So, when Cheyenne Rogers (Glenn Ford), an old friend with a criminal past, rolls into town, Upton is immediately on edge. Cheyenne assures his pal that all that's behind him now. But when the town bank is robbed, Cheyenne becomes the locals' number one suspect. He'll have to prove his innocence to save himself and his friend's reputation.

programme.title: Coroner Creek
programme.desc: A gunfighter (Randolph Scott) loses his beloved in a robbery and hunts the man (George Macready) to blame, who is living off the loot.

programme.title: The Man From Tumbleweeds
programme.desc: Ex-convict gunfighters join a state ranger (Bill Elliott) on patrol for outlaws.

programme.title: They Came to Cordura
programme.desc: On a mission to Mexico, U.S. Maj. Tom Thorn (Gary Cooper) is branded a coward, while several of his fellow servicemen are praised for showing bravery. Tom is asked to transport the heroes through harsh terrain so they can be honored. Also along for the journey is Adelaide Geary (Rita Hayworth), a woman charged with conspiring against the United States. But, as his fellow soldiers begin revealing their treacherous sides, Tom realizes that Adelaide is the only heroic one of the bunch.

programme.title: A Christmas Truce
programme.desc: An American soldier and a Belgian woman fall in love during a brief holiday truce amid the Battle of the Bulge

programme.title: Christmas By Candlelight
programme.desc: Wellness expert, Juliet, works on Christmas memory candles with boutique store owner Tom.

programme.title: Christmas in Scotland
programme.desc: A designer and wealthy heir must team up to bring holiday magic to a small community, making both realize they wish to spend every Christmas together.

programme.title: 12 Dares of Christmas
programme.desc: A high school teacher's quiet holidays get a jolt of spice as she and an assertive French teacher scramble to prepare a Christmas exchange program.

programme.title: Hearts Under the Olive Tree
programme.desc: Looking for inspiration for her next fantasy book, a renowned author is taken to a farmland retreat, where something even more magical awaits.

programme.title: Too Cool for Christmas
programme.desc: Lindsay thinks she is too cool to be with her family on Christmas. When she ends up delivering presents with Santa himself, she finds out what Christmas really means.

programme.title: Waking Up to Christmas
programme.desc: After being zapped by faulty Christmas lights, a workaholic finds herself the lead in an over-the-top Hallmark-style holiday movie.

programme.title: A Very English Christmas
programme.desc: Kate plans her English half-sister Harriets wedding with the help of Christmas market owner Dylan.

programme.title: The Fabric of Christmas
programme.desc: Liam, a fireman, and Amy, a quilting teacher, team up to make a Christmas quilt for Liam's sister.

programme.title: Christmas Casanova
programme.desc: Podcaster Elise partners with Daniyal to create an unforgettable Christmas, but it seems he's wooing the wrong woman amidst the festive chaos.

programme.title: Coupled Up For Christmas
programme.desc: Pretending to be a couple in order to win over their exes, Tiffany and Peter fall for each other.

programme.desc: When a vice president at a PR firm makes a deal with a coffee shop owner, she ends up getting more out of it than she had initially imagined.

programme.title: A Match for the Prince
programme.desc: A matchmaker risks falling for a real-life prince before his royal wedding date.

programme.title: At Home With Tori
programme.desc: Tori gets breast revision surgery and throws a party to raise awareness for breast health. Time for a Booby Bash!

programme.title: At Home With Tori
programme.desc: Tori hosts a Bring it Back themed luncheon for her neighbors in Hidden Hills with the help of Teddi Mellencamp.

programme.title: Best Friend From Heaven
programme.desc: When her dog is killed, Tara cancels her wedding. But her dog's ghost and her small town have a surprise.

programme.title: Been There All Along
programme.desc: After a public breakup, a determined dating app founder on the brink of bankruptcy must team up with a savvy marketing expert to save her company.

programme.title: Accidentally In Love
programme.desc: Edie finds true love in London just days before she is to return to the US. They are separated, but as fate would have it, they reunite 6 years later.

programme.title: A Royal Recipe for Love
programme.desc: When Emma is hired to bake for a royal cake, she finds herself at odds with a Prince.

programme.title: Becoming Ms. Bennett: Pride & Prejudice
programme.desc: A popular American vlogger is cast in a British film production of 'Pride and Prejudice', but struggles with her accent.

programme.title: A Royal Makeover
programme.desc: A royalty expert is tasked with turning an unkempt man into the king he is destined to beand gets a little more out of the deal than she imagined.

programme.title: Anatomy Of Deception
programme.desc: A district attorney tapped to replace the outgoing mayor, is stalked by a man who engineers her fall.

programme.title: Railroad Tigers
programme.desc: During WWII, a Chinese railroad worker leads resistance fighters against Japanese occupation forces.

programme.title: Chronicles of the Ghostly Tribe
programme.desc: After an explosion rocks an archaeological dig, a soldier faces a mystery that seems to defy death.

programme.title: Legend of the Demon Seal
programme.desc: Fengxue expresses her feelings with original comic books.

programme.title: Born to be King
programme.desc: When Chicken is set up, his old pals return to clear his name.

programme.title: Deliver Us From Evil
programme.desc: A secret-agent-turned-mercenary reemerges upon learning a kidnapping hits close to home.

programme.title: The Brink
programme.desc: Political strategist Steve Bannon prepares for the 2018 midterm elections in the United States by rallying together far-right causes.

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: A violent turf war overcomes a Mongolian neighborhood when the key enforcer, known as Big Brother, is jailed and two groups battle to replace him.

programme.title: Teahouse of the August Moon, The
programme.desc: Marlon Brando stars in this comedy about Americans who help build The Teahouse of the August Moon.

programme.title: Splendor in the Grass (1961)
programme.desc: Natalie Wood and Warren Beatty star as two teenaged lovers navigating 1928 Kansas in this romantic drama.

programme.title: A Night At The Opera
programme.desc: A seedy theatrical agent guarantees a patron a position in high society if she bankrolls an opera, but only if he manages to sign a famous tenor.

programme.title: Please Don't Eat the Daisies
programme.desc: A family relocates from the city to the suburbs. Challenges ensue when a damaging play review leads a famed actress to target the husband.

programme.title: Barkleys of Broadway, The
programme.desc: Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers star as a pair of stars who break up only to realize they need each other.

programme.title: Hill, The
programme.desc: Sean Connery stars as a prisoner who won't be broken by an evil guard in this drama directed by Sidney Lumet.

programme.title: Shall We Dance
programme.desc: A ballet dancer tries to woo a famous tap dancer, sparking a publicity frenzy over whether the pair are secretly married in this delightful musical.

programme.title: Mister Roberts

programme.title: Dinner at Eight
programme.desc: A fashionable dinner party is destined to be memorableas a disaster.

programme.title: The Bad Seed
programme.desc: A woman with a hidden past discovers the horrifying truth that within her seemingly angelic young daughter beats the heart of a cold-blooded killer.

programme.title: Them!

programme.title: Wild Rovers
programme.desc: Cowboy Ross Bodine decides to join his buddy in robbing a bank to finance a comfortable retirement.

programme.title: The Mummy (1959)
programme.desc: When three archeologists enter a tomb, they discover a mummy who vows to destroy the despoilers.

programme.title: Show Boat
programme.desc: A tale of music, bigotry and enduring love aboard a river Show Boat.

programme.title: Ben-Hur (1959)
programme.desc: The epic life of a Jewish man who is unjustly enslaved yet rises to greatness in Rome.

programme.title: What Ever Happened To Baby Jane?
programme.desc: Two aging sisters are connected by mutual dependency, jealousy and hatred.

programme.desc: A revived Count Dracula selects a young bride-to-be as his next victim.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Dr. Ray Langston (Laurence Fishburne), from the Las Vegas office, comes to Miami when a severed leg found in the Everglades is linked to a girl who went missing in Las Vegas a week earlier.

programme.desc: The team tries to stop a killer from striking again after the body of a kidnapped woman is found in an alley.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Reid's ability to connect with an autistic child may prove helpful in finding the boy's missing parents; two former colleagues help Prentiss search for an old adversary.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: After a series of murders, Prentiss becomes suspicious of a former nemesis (Sebastian Roch) and fears for the safety of her team.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Prentiss prepares to confront her nemesis at last; the team asks J.J. to help find Prentiss and capture Doyle.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team must stop a gang of suspected murderers that is targeting a new victim nightly.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team must investigate targeted killings in Florida while each member is dealing with feelings about losing Prentiss.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: A stalker in San Diego targets college students; Strauss scrutinizes the team after the loss of Prentiss.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team travels to a North Carolina town where one woman was found badly injured and another is missing, and discovers those may not be the only victims.

programme.title: 18 Wheels of Justice
programme.desc: As part of the witness-protection program, a special agent gains a new identity as truck driver Chance Bowman.

programme.title: 18 Wheels of Justice
programme.desc: An encounter at a truck stop embroils Chance Bowman in a widow's problems and an altercation with the local police.

programme.title: 18 Wheels of Justice
programme.desc: A minor accident delays Chance Bowman from moving on and introduces him to a talented mechanic with a tainted past.

programme.title: 18 Wheels of Justice
programme.desc: After a near-miss encounter with a hit man, Chance decides to stand and fight Calder.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: The team must save Cabe when he is captured during a secret mission in Djibouti, Africa, with his protege, Tim Armstrong (Scott Porter).

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: A deadly tornado threatens the lives of Team Scorpion during a mission to recover the remains of fallen Marines in Vietnam.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: The team is hired by the Department of Defense to test the security at Fort Knox by trying to break in and steal a precious artifact.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: In Chernobyl, Sylvester and Paige become trapped inside a decaying nuclear reactor that the team is trying to repair before a tragic meltdown.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: The team must outsmart mentally unstable ex-Scorpion member Mark Collins when he kidnaps Toby and threatens to kill him if his demands are not met.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: The team members set aside their personal and romantic issues when hackers take over targeted U.S. military aircraft and war ships, pointing the weaponry at American cities.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: The team members set aside their personal and romantic issues when hackers take over targeted U.S. military aircraft and war ships, pointing the weaponry at American cities.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: When Walter is accidentally launched into space in a rocket, Team Scorpion must find a way to bring him home before his oxygen runs out.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: While in the hospital after being shot at the lab, Brennan struggles with visions of her mother that defy her usual logic; evidence may link Brennan's attacker to the Jeffersonian.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: As the team investigates the death of a seemingly innocent 15-year-old boy, they learn that he was involved in illegal activity.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When a well-educated but eccentric intern starts working at the Jeffersonian, Brennan tries to be more open-minded about scientific questions.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a young man whose remains were found at a hazardous waste disposal facility; Cam and Arastoo struggle to keep their relationship secret; Brennan and Booth try to decide where to take their vacation.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The investigation into the death of a former Marine leads the team to a group obsessed with preparing for the apocalypse; Sweets finds an apartment.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The residents of Midsomer Magna are thrilled when a production crew arrives at the local manor house to film a version of The Scarlet Pimpernel. But the crew members aren't the only visitors to the area - Jones has spotted notorious criminal George Ince nearby. But when the director, Nick Cheney, is found dead - his head severed by a prop guillotine - Barnaby must discover who would have wanted the victim dead. It soon becomes clear that things are not so simple, and the detectives soon have to shift through varying motives, layered by lies, hidden truths, and a possible robbery to be committed.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is in Midsomer Holm, bidding farewell to reformed criminal Ronnie Tyler, who has taken part in a rehabilitation scheme in the village. Also present is disgraced ex-policeman Jack Colby, a former colleague of Barnaby's but Jack refuses to talk to his old friend. When Jack is murdered, the detective must delve into the dark secrets in the victim's past. There are certainly dark secrets to uncover, and Barnaby has to determine whether the victim's part in a scandal years earlier at Causton police station, is key to the mystery behind his death. It isn't long before he finds that Eddie Marston is attempting blackmail, and soon murdered as a result, and that Lord Holm is in love with Jack's wife, psychotherapist Gina.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The appearance of a headless horseman at Quitewell Hall foreshadows a number of deaths amongst an aristocratic family. In the midst of a Civil War re-enactment the family relive their own historic battles with their hostile neighbours. But what is the truth about the DeQuettevilles - and the ghostly rider?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a barrister is killed in Midsomer, suspicion falls on convicted murderer Grady Felton. Grady has just returned to the village where he committed the murder years ago amid much anger from locals. But Grady has a solid alibi. Barnaby suspects he is working with an accomplice - until Grady himself is targeted in an arson attack.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The murder of a journalist has chilling echoes of a 1960s horror film starring Midsomer's own Stella Harris. When Stella's more famous sister returns after a 40-year family rift, the killings escalate, each of them reminiscent of a movie plot. Is life - and death - imitating art?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As darkness covers Midsomer Stanton during a total eclipse of the sun, amateur astronomer Jeremy Harper is killed by a blow to the head with a meteorite. Barnaby and Jones soon discover intrigue, sexual tension and academic rivalry are rife among the star-seeking community.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Harriet Farmer wakes up after being in a coma since the night she tried to elope. Soon afterwards, a killer strikes members of a chess club. Could the attack which left Harriet for dead a year ago be linked to moves on a chess board? And where is her boyfriend Finn?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A woman is crushed to death with a giant round of cheese at the home of the world-famous Midsomer Blue. Secret and controversial plans to modernise the dairy are revealed while rumours about private lives of the parents cause a row at the prestigious local prep school. As other people linked to the dairy meet agonising deaths, long-held secrets start to emerge...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Midsomer is buzzing with excitement at the arrival of the annual Paramount Dance Extravaganza. But behind the sequins and smiles are deep running feuds and passions.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Prolific real estate agent Alexander Beauvoisin is murdered in front of a crowd at the unveiling of a new dolls house collection at Midsomer Museum of the family.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Deddingtons thriving bee Empire has put Granville Norton on the map, but what lengths will they go to to ensure theyre never dethroned

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Fishermen and women flock to the village of Solomon Gorge desperate to catch a giant fish that is said to lurk in the lake.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Exactly nine years after Ferdy Villers killed himself, his entire family reunites for Christmas unaware that someone is out for revenge.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: It's a good day for the Hicks family, as the name of Tommy Hicks - who was executed during World War I for "cowardice and desertion" - is added to the list on Midsomer Parva's war memorial. Tommy's son Lionel and grandson Dave, mayor of Causton and whom Barnaby does not like (owing to dodgy building work by the mayor's company), are thrilled, but the snooty Hammonds are decidedly less pleased. Henry, the patriarch of the Hammond family, is particularly riled by his insalubrious neighbours, and has nurtured a long-running feud with the Hickses. But the evening after a battle re-enactment in the village, Henry is murdered - and Barnaby must delve into the history of the two families to find the killer, discovering a web of fraud, lies, and hidden truths.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The residents of Milton Cross, a feudal estate with a church, farms, houses and acres of land, depend on lord of the manor Edward Milton for their livelihoods. But when Sonia Woodley is stabbed in the churchyard two years after the death of her abusive husband Gerald, Barnaby and Jones investigate, trying to work out who killed her. It soon becomes clear someone took a pair of tailor scissors to do the deed, but who amongst the villagers could have done so, is unclear, and the investigation is complicated, when the pair learn the local Anglican priest, the parish vicar, had received a letter from Sonia. When he himself is killed, the pair believe something in the letter may be key to solving the mystery.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is not convinced about Mayor David Hicks' plans to revive an annual trip to Brighton, suspecting his proposal to buy coastal land there, is rather a fraudulent scheme. Naturally, he joins the trip, but during their time in Brighton, a hated property developer (Tim McInnerny) is beheaded on a ghost house ride, prompting Barnaby to team up with his cousin to determine whether the developer's renters, the mayor, a gloomy reverend (Mark Gatiss), or the lady of a large estate are responsible, and soon discovers a hotbed of jealously, debt, lies and more, conceal a far darker secret.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Ford Florey is a town with a Wild West Society and many grudges. During a Wild West show at the local faire, the witch on the 'Dunk the Witch' stall is well and truly dunked but laughter soon turns to horror when she doesn't get up and the water in the tank starts to turn red. Barnaby and Jones need to be quick on the draw to track down the murderer, and soon begin to wonder whether a dispute over land was the motive, or something far more sinister, especially when more people are killed, with methods linked to the Wild West.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: On a dark night in the village of March Magna, Barnaby's wife Joyce swerves her car and narrowly misses a shadowy figure in the road - or so she thinks, when later that night a body is discovered in the old cemetery. The victim was a member of the council who was strange and weird, but someone seemed to have quite a grudge on him, and so Barnaby and Jones delve into his background, and the village, attempting to determine who might have wanted him dead, finding ghosts, grudges, and more beneath the village's surface.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Piano student Zoe Stock has won a place at the Devington Manor Winter School led by internationally renowned musician, Sir Michael Fielding (James Fox). Yet when she is there, things become mysterious when from the river bank in the grounds of the manor she sees a woman jump from the bridge and disappear underwater. When Barnaby and Jones start investigating the possible drowning, they discover unsavoury connections to the past that could prove lethal 20 years later, especially when someone attempts to kill. It isn't long, before murder does occur, and the detectives attempt to fathom what occurred in the drowning, and the present day murders.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Midsomer Morchard's very own boxer, John Kinsella, wins a world title in New York, the success seems to be a joyous time for all, until murder rears its ugly head. When a local solicitor is found dead by his assistant and Kinsella's manager, Barnaby attempts to determine what is going on, and soon discover issues with inheritance, affairs, anger, and gambling to make matters difficult. Meanwhile Kinsella's trainer Teddy Molloy (Phil Daniels) has his own hidden agenda. When a re-enactment of a Victorian boxing match gets heated, and Kinsella's manager is found dead in his home's gym, the pair attempt to determine who is responsible, although Barnaby's judgement seems to be clouded on this one.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A planning dispute turns to murder, after a leading light in the Midsomer Conservation Society suspects her neighbours are involved in a money-making development scam. Political wrangling, burglaries and sexual liaisons abound in picturesque Great Pelfe - but when a member of the possible scam is themselves murdered, Barnaby wonders what is truly going on behind the scenes of an important by-election.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby reluctantly accompanies Joyce on a spa weekend to Swavely Manor. But as he attempts to de-stress, a woman is found dead in the flotation chamber. He abandons his treatment to investigate, but his personal worries are never far away as he contemplates his future, while trying to determine if an argument between the spa's owners and their neighbours is the motive, or something else.

programme.title: Super Sleuths - Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Midsomer Murders team opens up about their experience of working on the popular crime drama and provides insight into the overall process of bringing it to the small screen.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The closing of what was once a very popular public garden in Midsomer Deverell sparks a series of murders that have Inspector Barnaby and Sgt. Troy stumped.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Following the funeral of local hotelier Karl Wainwright, his hotel's manager and a well liked Punch and Judy performer, Gregory Chambers, disappears unusually in yet another picturesque Midsomer village. Most people dismiss his disappearance completely but when he doesn't turn up, a search is conducted and a severed hand, confirmed to be Gregory's, turns up in the woods. Further deaths and a mushroom poisoning occur surrounding the beneficiaries of Karl Wainwright's will. All is not as it seems.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A man's naked body found under mysterious circumstances, within a crop circle on Sir Harry Chatwyn's wheat field, leads police to investigating how he wound up in the field after being electrocuted. While the nearby village of Midsomer Parva is abuzz with UFO mania, Barnaby is unconvinced by a local ufologist that the man's death was the result of alien activity, as he uncovers rivalries, theft and hatred during his investigations, soon after a well known burglar is found dead in another crop circle with identical injuries.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones are forced to take part in a team building exercise and Tom has plenty of problems dealing with the young, new, acting Chief Superintendent, John Cotton (Nick Fletcher). Following an explosion in a truck that had been stored in a truck depot, a body is soon discovered in a nearby lake, which turns out to be Alec Grainger, who had been seen arguing with James Parkes (Joseph Millson), the son of Colonel Matt Parkes (Tim Pigott-Smith). James appears to be involved in shady business deals and is blamed by his grandmother Caroline Halsey (Judy Parfitt) - and others - for the suicide of a woman he got pregnant two years before. Barnaby and Jones find themselves delving into a mixture of fraud, smuggling, and lies, trying to piece together the truth.

programme.title: Breaking the Band
programme.desc: Five working-class boys from England leave their factory town in search of fame and fortune.

programme.title: Iron Maiden: Breaking the Band
programme.desc: Formed in the late 1970s and racking up more than a 100 million album sales, British band Iron Maiden has been heavy metal's undisputed king for nearly 40 years.

programme.title: Twisted Sister: Breaking The Band
programme.desc: In 1984, Twisted Sister was one of the biggest heavy metal bands on the planet. After a decade battling to the top, this Long Island bar band became legendary on MTV, but the band's demise was spectacular.

programme.title: Whitesnake: Story of Their Songs
programme.desc: Delving into the six songs that helped British blues rockers Whitesnake become global rock icons, from their early origins in England though to their '80s U.S. chart-topping smash hit.

programme.title: Breaking the Band
programme.desc: ZZ Top struggles to gain national recognition despite massive success in the South.

programme.title: Van Halen: Breaking the Band
programme.desc: At the height of their success, Van Halen is one of the biggest rock bands in the world, infamous for their excess and raucous live performances.

programme.title: Metallica: Breaking the Band
programme.desc: With a combined fortune of $900 million and being a band for four decades, Metallica is one of the biggest selling heavy metal bands in history.

programme.title: Motley Crue's Vince Neil: My Story
programme.desc: Motley Crue lead singer Vince Neil gives insight into his life, telling the story of his road to stardom and the many bumps in the road that accompanied it.

programme.title: On Patrol: Live
programme.desc: Coweta County officers respond to a burglary in progress; Richland County officers investigate a fight at a family restaurant.

programme.title: On Patrol: Live
programme.desc: Officers respond to an accident where a driver appears intoxicated; officers search for suspects after a fast-food restaurant employee is attacked; officers investigate a sibling dispute; deputies are called to reports of a break-in.

programme.title: Breaking the Band
programme.desc: German heavy metal band Scorpions is one of the most successful international rock bands.

programme.title: Jon Bon Jovi: Frontman
programme.desc: For almost 40 years Jon Bon Jovi has fronted one of the world's biggest rock bands, Bon Jovi. With hits like "Livin' On A Prayer" and "Bad Medicine," their album sales topped 130 million. Jon Bon Jovi is equally successful as a solo artist and actor.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: While hunting for collectables in Central Iowa, Mike and Frank meet 88-year-old WWII veteran Leland and buy the Japanese sword he brought back from the war.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: A storm is growing as Mike and Frank are determined to retrieve an iconic American sports car that's so rare they've never even heard of it.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys are in the South and running low on cash. They're desperate for a good pick when they happen upon a massive old junkyard and closed-down family flea market.

programme.desc: Flying solo in Northern Iowa, Mike comes across the "Goat Man" and combs through his amazing, hidden-away property of junk-filled fields and buses. An Illinois couple's home proves to be a collector's paradise.

programme.desc: The buyers invade Hialeah, Fla.; Greg and Lindsey uncover a shiny treasure trove; Jorge and Maydel visit a sugary wonderland; Kevin attempts to break the other bidders.

programme.desc: The auction season concludes with a bang in Fort Worth. Moe the junk-hoarding foot doctor, now limited to one locker a year by his wife, returns for his annual purchase.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers head east to Longview, Texas, where Jenny attempts a bold new strategy. Rangers Ricky and Bubba attempt to both go big and go home, Matt Blevins resorts to scare tactics.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The upscale hamlet of Haslet, Texas hosts the auction, and some old hands show up to compete for abandoned treasures.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The auction action returns to Longview, which Kenny declares to be his "East Texas stomping grounds." Bubba, working solo, aims for an item that could make him go blind, while Mary simply tries to keep her chi in balance.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas

programme.desc: The buyers return to Waxahachie, where Vic and his prot g Sonny Monday discover an item that leads them to Dallas Stars co-captain Jamie Benn. Ricky and Bubba take a boat to Houston.

programme.desc: The auction hasn't even begun in the east Texas town of Henderson before a fight breaks out among the buyers. After the smoke clears, Ricky takes a couple of rounds while Kenny gets taken to the bank.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: On one of the hottest days of summer, the buyers roll into Mesquite, Texas, where Ricky and Bubba have been burned in the past. Vic lets his prot g Sonny lose and gets taken to the mat.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers return to Waxahachie, where Vic and his prot g Sonny Monday discover an item that leads them to Dallas Stars co-captain Jamie Benn. Ricky and Bubba take a boat to Houston.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Miami
programme.desc: The buyers visit Florida City, Fla.; Maydel spots something from her past; Kevin looks for a big locker with big money; Greg and Lindsey go cuckoo over their unit; Yorgen and Christian gamble on a backpack.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Miami
programme.desc: The buyers return to Miramar, Fla.; Kevin lands a locker with bite; Greg and Lindsey take an interest in appliances; Christian's gamble leads to Yorgen's fall.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers invade Hialeah, Fla.; Greg and Lindsey uncover a shiny treasure trove; Jorge and Maydel visit a sugary wonderland; Kevin attempts to break the other bidders.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase and Jep get into an argument over which of them is the rightful heir to their grandfather's old rifle, they decide to settle the argument with a marksmanship contest.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Si has started moonlighting as a grocery bagger, the guys show up at the store and their teasing inadvertently causes Si to lose his job and his chance to enter a local bagging competition.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When a large storm hits Monroe, most of the adults head to Phil and Kay's to help protect their house from flooding while Jess, Sadie, Rebecca and Cole babysit the kids.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie accompanies Kay to a local bingo tournament and gets seduced by the game, eventually embarrassing himself and Kay with his enthusiasm.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie takes Sadie on a tour of a local college in hopes of convincing her to stay nearby after her impending high school graduation.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the Robertson brothers debate which of their wives makes the best cornbread, it escalates into a full-on cornbread cook off. Meanwhile, when Jep, Martin, and Godwin play a practical joke on Uncle Si.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The guys enjoy a one-day rodeo fantasy camp where they learn the ins and outs of riding, roping and clowning.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After leaving school to pursue music, Jase feels that Reed needs some structure in his life, so he hires him to take his place at Duck Commander.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: A compilation of the best scenes from all 11 seasons of A&E's hit series Duck Dynasty.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertson family throws a party for Willie & Korie's 25th anniversary, but things take a dramatic turn when Willie and Korie reveal a big secret. Meanwhile, when Jase blames Uncle Si for getting him a parking ticket.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie asks a local chainsaw artist to make him a statue, he gets a big surprise when it's revealed that the statue is of an unlikely subject -- Willie himself. Meanwhile, Jep and Jessica attempt to help Kay with her hoarding.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: On a trip to New York, Jase's son Reed proposes to his girlfriend, which inspires his father to fan the flames of romance back home with Missy.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The tables are turned when the HOA comes to Jase for help to rid the neighborhood of a menacing beaver.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase accompanies Willie on a business trip to Arkansas to pitch a new product and has unorthodox sales strategies. Back in Monroe, Jep and Si have to track down an important item of Willie's that they accidentally shipped out.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie thinks his kids have been spending too much time on their phones and other devices so he initiates a "No-Tech Week," but when he has to participate too it ends up being harder than he thought.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie and Jase run against each other to become president of their neighborhood HOA. Jep, Jess and Miss Kay work on a Duck Commander themed display for the local zoo.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie buys a 3D printer for the office that starts off as a fun distraction for the guys until it appears the printer could soon replace their jobs. Si, upset that Willie invested in the 3D printer and didn't give him a raise, invests in John Luke's Sno­Cone stand.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase, Jep, Si and Cole try to fight back a growing population of cottonmouth snakes on Phil's property. Meanwhile, Willie uses his business expertise to help Rebecca improve her clothing store.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie puts Little Will on a budget for his first car but it backfires when Will decides to get a motorcycle instead.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: While many of the guys' wives and children are in Africa doing charity work, Willie and Jase get into a debate over tracking ability which leads to a challenge--can Jase and Si track and capture Willie and Jep?

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Korie still in Africa, Willie and Jep must step in and supervise Bella's sleepover. When a couple boys play a prank on the girls, Willie and Jep prove to be the perfect chaperones for the task.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Korie challenges Willie to come up with a romantic gesture without spending any money. Missy and Jase compete to see who can find a girlfriend for Mountain Man.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase's hopes to win the inaugural Duck Commander Fishing Tournament is buoyed when he is able to enlist the help of legendary angler Bill Dance. Meanwhile, Willie's vanity over his greying beard leads him to make a questionable decision.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase and Jep make a deal with Mia and Merritt to get them to go dove hunting with them. Si tries to make some extra cash by starting a West Monroe tour.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jumping Asian carp have invaded Monroe's waters so Jase and the guys set out to try to stop them from spreading further. Meanwhile, Willie and Si have to run Willie's Duck Diner for the day.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The ice road season opens and quickly claims its first victim with a road-closing wreck.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Failing trailer brakes and trash talk over the CB threaten to derail Lisa's comeback.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The brutal Alaskan winter hits Prudhoe Bay with a vengeance, unleashing a ruthless windstorm.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: A phase-three storm hammers Atigun Pass; Alex hits a whiteout coming from Prudhoe; Hugh and Jack hatch a plan to keep the weather from hurting their paychecks; Ray and Lisa make their own plans to keep the loads moving.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Jack Jesse rushes to save an Alaskan town with an emergency fuel delivery, but a blinding storm stops him cold on the thin ice of the frozen river road to Nuiqsut.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The pressure on the drivers builds as the temperatures plunge to 55 below; Jack gets into it with a southbound driver; Hugh gets an earful from an American driver; Alex picks up a hitchhiker; Ray takes on Atigun Pass.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: When an avalanche strikes, Jack is stranded and left helpless as he watches the DOT clean up the carnage.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog shows his love of justice and children in this poignant episode. He begins by giving encouragement to a group of handicapped children and making them honorary members of his posse.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's got a twofer on his hands, but the cases couldn't be more different. The first is a woman whose family wants her back in jail, the other is a former choirboy whose family ties are strong.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog thinks he's got an average day of bounty hunting ahead of him, but he couldn't be more wrong. Beth calls a client, Daphne, whose bond they have to revoke and makes a shocking discovery.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog just can't resist a challenge, especially if it's to help out a friend. Jim is a bondsman and longtime friend of Dog. Jim's son has just started in the family business.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It's Halloween, and before Dog and Beth can help the kids carve their pumpkins, they have some business to attend to. It involves knocking on doors and meeting the neighbors but instead of hunting for treats they're on the search for a fugitive.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Going after two fugitives in one day is tough enough without the facing Colorado's notoriously unpredictable weather. Today it's the threat of sever thunderstorm, hail and area wide tornado warnings.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It takes years to become a seasoned bondsman, and the tenderfoot Alysin has a lot to learn. She not only bailed out a man facing charges of theft on just his promise to pay the fee but also without a co-signer for his bond.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog visits his mother's grave for inspiration before heading out to find Frankie, a violent fugitive hiding in the jungle.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team really have their hands full when they go after a tough guy named Nunu, who leads them on a chase through apartment complexes and a shopping mall before he's finally captured. But Dog is charmed by Nunu's unquenchable

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog knows very little about Peter, but what he does know, he doesn't like! Not only is he currently facing two counts of second degree sexual assault, he's racked up numerous restraining orders over the years.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The team is still in Colorado, and today Dog starts his day by to giving his kids and crew a sample of their western heritage by taking them horseback riding. This hunt takes Dog back to his old stomping grounds in Denver.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: This one is close to home. Dog's target on today's hunt is the cousin of Kali, Garry Boy's caregiver. In addition she has a reputation as a brawler. With Duane Lee still missing from the team Baby Lyssa decides she will step-up in this hunt.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today, Dog and the boys are going after a fugitive with a serious price tag. Tim failed to appear in court on a $25,000 bond and has a string of theft charges behind him.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog shows his love of justice and children in this poignant episode. He begins by giving encouragement to a group of handicapped children and making them honorary members of his posse.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today's case involves a Samoan so Dog knows that the runner's close-knit kinfolk hold the keys to bringing him in.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog, Beth and the team are in Colorado and today they face a special Chapman challenge--getting the kids to camp. After the drop-off, Dog is more than ready to track down a fugitive.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team must deal with misleading informants, belligerent boaters, and angry drunks when they go after Kimberly, a traffic offender with over 20 violations. And if that isn't enough, Dog has another problem -- Duane Lee is sick.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: What starts out as a perfect day for Dog turns ugly fast. He and Beth just bought bunnies for their kids, and Dog is enjoying helping them learn to care for their new pets. But duty calls and this is a tough case to fathom.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog just can't resist a challenge, especially if it's to help out a friend. Jim is a bondsman and longtime friend of Dog. Jim's son has just started in the family business.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Beth designs a luxurious new office for the team and shows it off to Dog, but the bounty hunter is more interested in starting his hunt for Federico, who's been revoked for missing court dates and generally running amuck.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's target today seems to have a taste for drugs and a record of reckless driving. The hunt has deep emotional resonance for the team because today is the anniversary of the fatal car accident of Dog's daughter Barbara Katie.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's target for today has been in trouble with the law since he was a juvenile. And he seems willing to use any trick in the system to avoid capture by Dog. In this match of wits, will Dog prevail?

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: For a guy who started life as a free spirited outlaw-biker Dog has certainly turned into a family man. His children touch everything he does today, from searching for the perfect gift for his daughter Cecily's birthday to hunting a fugitive.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: There's no rest for the righteous and nobody knows this better then the Dog. He is committed to saving his new friend's bail bonding business, and now must race against time to bring a rogues gallery to justice.
